A mother and her two children are slaughtered by Islamic extremists in an attack on their village in the Algerian desert.
Islamic terrorists kill on person with a roadside bomb.
Palestinian gunmen ambush a vehicle and kill four Jewish children and their pregnant mother who were in the process of entering their community.  Islamic Jihad takes credit for the brutal attack.
Two police officers are gunned down by Islamists while on-duty.
Three community guards are killed by Islamists.  A fourth is kidnapped.
Two soldiers are killed when a bomb planted by Islamic extremists explodes under their car.  Four others are injured.
Sunni mortar attack on a U.S. base kills five sailors and one soldier.
Separate Taliban attacks in southern Afghanistan leave ten security officers dead.
Pakistani radicals bomb a bus carrying Chinese engineers to a port project.  Three are killed and eleven injured.
Jemaah Islamiya set a bomb at a grocery store, killing two people and injuring four others.
Two British civilians, working to register Afghans for upcoming elections, are killed along with their translator in a suspected Taliban ambush.
Militant Muslim lobs a grenade at a polling booth, killing one and injuring two.
Muslim gunmen in a speedboat kill a Christian man and an 11-month-old baby.  Three others are also shot, but manage to survive.
Muslim police take three Christians, including a priest, into custody as they are repairing a church wall.  All three are then murdered.
Islamic terrorists kill three police officers in an IED attack.
Suicide car bomber kills five civilians and one soldier at a checkpoint.  Twenty-three other civilians injured in the blast.
Car carrying a government official is attacked by Sunni extremists, killing him and the driver, and wounding his wife.
Catholic student abducted by Muslim school refuses to convert to Islam and is tortured to death.
Roadside terrorist bombing kills four Iraqi policeman.
An award-winning Polish journalist is shot to death, along with an Algerian colleague by Sunni insurgents in a drive-by attack.
Thirteen worshippers are killed, and more than eighty others injured when a suicide bomber detonates his explosives inside a Shiite mosque.
Two people are gunned down in separate attacks by Islamic separatists, including a man riding home on a motorcycle.
Islamic militants are suspected in an ambush that leaves six campaign workers dead.
Two foreigners, one a Swiss citizen, are stoned to death in a public park.
Militant Muslim lobs a grenade at a hospital, killing one and injuring fifteen others.
Jihadists assassinate the Chechen President and at least twenty-three others in a stadium blast that leaves more than fifty, including elderly and children severely injured.
Terrorists kill a child and six others by exploding a bomb in a crowded market.  Thirteen others are injured.
Radicals shoot two foreign civilians and one Iraqi to death in front of their house.
Insurgents kill a four-year-old girl in a rocket strike.
"Allahu Akbar" shout jubilant al-Qaeda members as they cut off the head of an American (civilian) prisoner on video.  Elsewhere in the city, a Russian contractor is killed and two others abducted.
Hamas terrorists trigger a land mine blast under an APC, killing six young Israeli soldiers.  Hamas also takes the body parts to prevent their recovery.
At least eleven Christians are burned to death by a Muslim mob that also sets two churches on fire.
Abu Sayyaf terrorists kill a fifteen-year-old Catholic girl with a grenade - fourteen others are also injured in the attack.
Muslim rampage against Christians continues in Kano with at least another thirty people losing their lives.
Philippine warehouse worker is killed, and four other civilian employees injured in a mortar attack on a U.S. base from a residential neighborhood.
Another remote-controlled landmine attack by Islamic Jihad on an APC kills five additional Israeli soldiers attempting to block off tunnel used by Palestinian terrorists.
Hamas snipers kill an Israeli soldier as he was in the process of bringing food to an elderly Palestinian woman's house.  A soldier attempting to help the first was killed as well.

Seven members of a Shia' family, including two women and two children (one a 7-year-old girl) are bound and executed in their home with a bullet to each head.  'Shiites are Infidels' is found written on the wall.
Terrorists gun down two police officers returning home from work.
Four civilians were killed, and seventeen others injured by a mortar attack on a recruitment office.
Iraqi woman working as a translator for the coalition is killed in her home.
Muslim radical opens fire on a minibus carrying Christian women, forcing them to the side of the road.  He then tosses an explosive in the vehicle, killing three, including the driver.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills the Iraqi governing council president and at least six others.  Eight were reported to be injured in the blast.
Muslims bomb three Buddhist temples on Sunday, injuring two.  The next day they shoot a police officer in the head, as he is riding to work.
Three separate Jihad attacks leave twelve Russian servicemen dead and at least three injured or kidnapped.
Four members of Pakistan's Christian minority are targeted and killed by Islamists.  One was a kidnapped youth and two others were on their way to a picnic.
Palestinian bombs take the lives of two Arab teenagers - a sixteen-year-old girl and her 13-year-old brother - who were washing clothes on the roof of their house when hit by the shrapnel.
Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat, an Islamic extremist group kills two Algerian soldiers and injures thirteen others in two bombing ambushes.
Muslim Nigerians kill eighteen Christian villagers - mostly farmers, women and children.
Islamists fire indiscriminately into a crowd at a pavilion, killing three civilians and injuring two.
Jihadists kill twenty-four Christian villagers.
Ten Christian villagers are killed by armed Muslims.  An unknown number are injured by the attackers, who also burned churches and houses.
Hizb-ul-Mujahideen terrorists kill three, including two children, and injure about two dozen with a bomb planted on a bicycle.
Bomb blast kills one Iraqi civilian and injures four others.
Jihadists kill four Iraq security personnel manning a road block by driving up and then unloading with RPGs and weapons fire.
At least two people are killed by a bomb blast at a shrine.  Some fifty others, including a British diplomat are injured.
In the latest of a series of attacks on Christian villagers, seven more are killed by Nigerian Jihadists as they sought refuge in their homes.
Fifteen Christian villagers are massacred by Jihadists.
Muslim separatists shoot a police corporal to death as he is walking home.
A 19-year-old suicide bomber kills himself and injures four others at a checkpoint.
A German caterer is shot in the head and body, execution-style, on the sidewalk outside a shopping mall.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills six other Iraqis and injures at least ten.  In addition to improving the bomber's afterlife, the blast was intended to kill a ministry official and his wife.
Arab militia kill fifty-six African villagers in a raid.  The government-supported terrorists targeted black civilians in their attack.
Five Russians are killed when Jihadists blow up their vehicle and then open fire with assault rifles.
Hizb-ul-Mujahideen militants trigger a bomb under a bus carrying security personnel and their families.  Thirty-three people, including six women and three children are killed.
Three Afghan security personnel are killed in a Taliban ambush while they are escorting a food and medical supply shipment to an impoverished area.
Terrorists fire on a vehicle, killing a university student and a police official.
Five members of a family, including two children (ages 4 and 7), are killed in an insurgent mortar attack.
Islamic terrorists kill two British civilians in a rocket attack on their vehicle.
Bomb blast in the Christian sector of the city kills one and injures thirteen.  A second bomb is found near a church and defused.
An Iraqi boy is killed, and four other civilians injured when a car bomb explodes outside a hotel, near the Australian consul's office.
Fulani militia attacks a government building, killing three workers and injuring at least six.  They also burned houses.
Four policemen are killed, and four others injured in an attack by Muslim rebels.
Twin Jihadist car bombings outside the Pakistan-American cultural center kill one and injure at least twenty-two others.

Two Russian civilian contractors and two Iraqi civilians are killed in a shooting attack on their bus as it is pulling out from a power plant.  This follow the 5/10 beating death of another Russian civilian.
A Baptist pastor gunned down by members of the Islamist group, Bayrat.
Fedayeen insurgents attack a vehicle carrying a member of the Iraqi governing council.  Her son and bodyguard are killed.
In five separate attacks in the J&K, militant Muslims assassinate four civilians and one former SP officer.  Two others are abducted and missing.
Assault by armed Muslims leaves three Christians dead and several hundred homeless after their village is burned.
Sudanese warplanes bomb a Christian village, killing at least twenty.
Two Japanese journalists on their way to pick up a 10-year-old blinded child for treatment in Japan are attacked by a Muslim mob, dragged out of their car and beaten to death.
Five Islamic terrorists invade a home and kill an elderly man, a 2-year-old boy, and the boys mother.  All are shot to death.
At least seven people are killed, and more than eighty injured in a bomb blast.  The government in neighboring Sudan is suspected of funding the Islamic groups responsible for these attacks.
Pakistani Christian who was attacked with a hammer by a policeman for violating the State's blasphemy laws dies of his injuries.  The killer claimed he wanted to "earn a spot in Paradise."
A Christian prosecutor, working to keep three Bali bombers in jail, is assassinated by Jemaah Islamiah extremists in his car.
Muslim radicals kidnap a Buddhist civilian and decapitate him.  They leave the body with a note attached, warning other Buddhists of the same fate.
"Are you Christian or Muslim," ask al-Qaeda militants as they shoot twenty-two infidels to death, including a 10-year-old boy, and take over forty-five hostages in an attack on an office complex.
Taliban assassins riding motorbikes swoop into a town and shoot up a government building, killing four and injuring eight.
Senior Sunni cleric, age 72, is assassinated in an ambush by Shia radicals.
Four Iraqis are killed in a car bombing.  Another twenty-five are injured.
Sunni suicide bomber targets a Shia mosque.  Nineteen worshippers are killed and at least thirty-five others injured.
Fundamentalists target a Minster of Education who proposed reduced Islamist influence in a new curriculum.  She survives the rocket attack, but a 14-year-old boy is killed and a dozen others injured.
Islamic fundamentalists ambush a security patrol, killing three Algerians and wounding eleven.
Three are killed, and more than twenty injured by a car bombing targeting the minority Kurds, who are seen as infidels by the other Muslim sects.
Car bombing by Sunni terrorists kills eleven Iraqis and injures twenty-six.
Attack by gunmen on the former UN headquarters leaves a policeman and a civilian dead.
The Islamic Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat attack an Algerian security convoy, killing at least eleven.
Five people rushing to help an injured woman are killed by a car bomb.  Thirty-seven others are injured in the terrorist blast.
Five members of Doctors Without Borders, the international aid group that provides medical assistance to the impoverished are killed by the Taliban in an ambush on their vehicle.
al-Qaeda suicide bomber kills a border guard and injures two others.
A political activist is assassinated by militant Muslims.  Another civilian his killed in his home in a separate attack (Kishtwar).
Islamic fundamentalists explode a bomb outside a movie theater.
Ten people are killed in a bomb explosion in an outdoor market.  Another forty are injured by the blast, which is attributed to militant Muslims.
Jihadists attack a Russian convoy, killing four and injuring five with grenades and automatic weapons.
Islamic extremists ambush and kill a policeman and two village guards.
Hezb-ul-Mujahedeen gunmen invade a home and kill a 55-year-old woman and her daughter.
Militants fire RPGs at jobseekers lining up outside a recruitment office.  Seventeen are injured.
At least nine people, including an infant and two women are killed when a state bus is set on fire by organized Islamic terrorists.  About thirty others are hospitalized for serious burns.
Jihadists disguise themselves as police officers to gain entrance to a police station, then proceed to kill seven officers in cold blood.
Mujahideen gunmen kill four civilian contractors in an ambush - two Americans and two Poles.
Two suicide bombers, belonging to a group calling itself the 'Unification and Jihad Group' kill nine Iraqis and injure forty-eight others.
17-year-old Christian teenager is shot to death in a restaurant by Muslim terrorists.
Female Shia doctor is gunned down by Sunni radicals outside a hospital.  Her driver is seriously wounded in the attack.
Islamist shoots a Briton to death on the sidewalk.  One other is injured in the attack.
In the same Christian neighborhood as the morning drive-by, Islamic extremists murder four, including three women returning from work.
Islamic terrorists target Christian workers in a morning shooting attack that leaves four dead and several wounded.
Muslim gunmen shoot a Buddhist teacher to death on the street, one of two Buddhist civilians killed in separate attacks.
Two policemen are killed in a Taliban attack on their station.
Six European coalition troops are killed by a mortar fired at their base.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills six, including five civilians, and injures over two dozen with his attack, which took place on a busy road at rush hour.
Ten Iraqis are killed by a car bombing.  Dozens of others are injured in the terrorist attack.
American civilian gunned down by Islamists at his home in Saudi Arabia.
Jihad attacks leave nine Russian soldiers and one policeman dead over a 24-hour period.
A 21-year-old man is stabbed to death by Muslim gang members for refusing to convert to Islam.
A Christian man is attack and murdered by Islamists in his home.
Militant Muslims shoot four members of a family to death, including two women and a 6-year-old child.
Islamic militants ambush a convoy in a busy residential neighborhood.  The intended target escapes the shooting attack, but eleven others are killed.
Taliban attack a construction site and shoot to death eleven Chinese nationals working there. Four others are injured.
A man riding on an Atlanta commuter train mutters Qur'anic verses then attacks an army officer for no other apparent reason.  An elderly woman and two arresting officers are hurt as well.
al-Qaeda members kill three hostages kidnapped the day before by cutting their throats.  The three were employees of a telecommunications company.
Jihadis explode a bomb under a police vehicle, killing three occupants.
Islamic fundamentalists detonate an IED as four civilians walking by.
Two policemen are killed in a Jihad bombing attack.
Abu Sayyaf place a bomb outside a restaurant which kills one person.
Islamist kills five tourists, including two children with a grenade lobbed inside a crowded hotel.  Twenty-eight others are injured.
al-Qaeda kills an American civilian as he is parking his car outside his home and kidnaps another American.
Twenty-two civilians are injured, four critically by an Islamist who threw a grenade into a busy street.  One victim later dies in the hospital (6/14/04).
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills thirteen Iraqis and injures at least a dozen with a car bomb.
Extremists assassinate two government officials in separate shooting attacks.
Islamic militant hurls a grenade at the house of a retired government official, killing the man, his sister and seriously injuring his son.
A father and son are shot to death in their home by Muslim terrorists.

A suicide bomber targets foreign civilian contractors working to restore the country's power plants.  Thirteen people, other than this religious man, were killed immediately and more than sixty injured.
A rubber farmer is murdered by Muslim terrorists while riding in his truck.
Four people assassinated in as many days by Fedayeen.  The civilian victims are an oil company executive, a cleric, district mayor and the father of a policeman.
Four citizens, including two children and an elderly man are killed by a Taliban remote-control bomb.
Muslim separatists kill an 18-year-old college student, a school janitor and a police officer in a drive-by shooting attacks.  They also bomb a police check-point, injuring five.

'Holy Warrior' suicide bomber kills at least thirty-five Iraqi civilians and injures nearly one-hundred and fifty other innocents who happened to be on a busy street near a recruiting center.  The vehicle used was apparently packed with artillery rounds.
Car bombing by Sunni insurgents kills six member of the Iraqi Defense Forces and injures four.
Family members of captured hostage appeal to kidnappers humanity with children and grandchildren.  Islamists quote from the Qur'an, praise Allah and then cut the victim's head off.
The Islamic government kills two student demonstrators, along with a 50-year-old shop owner.
A Buddhist teacher is shot to death by Muslim extremists.
Remote-controlled bomb kills two oil workers and one Iraqi security personnel.
Militant Muslims spray a police car with an AK-47, killing the driver.  The same group injures four others with a bomb.
Husband and wife are killed when "holy" warriors fire rocket into their home.
Government-backed militia burns several villages and kill six civilians.  More than a thousand are displaced.
Sunni extremists kill ten civilians and police in a mortar attack.
A policeman is killed and an election worker, along with four others are injured in a Taliban motorcycle attack.
Jihad fighters rampage through a town, shooting in cold blood or burning to death at least fifty-seven people and injuring another sixty.
Palestinian terrorists attack a Jewish settlement, killing a greenhouse worker from Thailand.
Eleven are injured in a fundamentalist car bombing of a power plant.
A religious teacher is gunned down by Islamic separatists in his home.
Car bomb explodes in a residential neighborhood, killing three, including a 3-year-old girl and injuring another six civilians.
al-Qaeda group "Monotheism and Jihad" beheads a Korean hostage in front of a banner praising Allah.
Islamists stab a female law professor to death on her doorstep.  Her husband is killed in the same manner.
A mother and her child are among three killed by a roadside bomb.  Two other civilians are wounded in the blast.
As their father waited at home for their return, two Christian sisters are gunned down by Muslim extremists in a particularly heinous and senseless murder.
Thirty-five more bodies are found from the attack on a town by Jihad terrorists.  The number injured doubles to one-hundred nineteen.
Taliban extremists shoot a rocket at an Afghan military vehicle on security patrol.  Five killed, two injured.
Islamic fundamentalists stop a car on a remote road carrying members of a family and slit the throats of all five - ages 8 to 50.

Series of coordinated terrorist attacks, including suicide bombings and other Fedayeen tactics kill over one-hundred Iraqis and injure hundreds more across the country.  Recorded message says 'killings will continue until Islamic rule back on earth.'
Muslim separatists attack an army base, killing one Thai soldier and injuring two others.
The Taliban stops a bus in a remote area, kidnaps sixteen people carrying voter registration cards, then kills them in brutal fashion.
Government official shot to death as he left a restaurant with his wife, who was badly injured in the assassination.
Twelve people, including a woman and five children are killed by militant Muslim gunmen who enter a remote village and force the people out of their homes.  Ethnic cleansing appears to be the motive.
Car bombing kills one, injures twenty.  In Erbil, a shooting and grenade attack on a Shiite political office leaves two guards dead.
Two female election workers and one child are killed, and nine other women and two children are badly injured when a Taliban-planted bomb explodes on a bus.
Lashkar-e-Toiba terrorists kidnap two Hindus (a railway engineer and his brother) on Wednesday, then slit their throats.
Twenty-three civilians are killed by two car bombings near a Shiite mosque in Hilla.  About sixty others are injured in the blasts.
Islamic terrorist explode a bomb near a roadside cafe, killing one civilian.
Muslim group plants a bomb under a soccer field to kill off-duty policemen, who were inaugurating a youth league.
al-Aqsa terrorist group digs a 350-meter tunnel under an Israeli guard post, detonates explosives, then uses assault rifles to prevent ambulance crews from rescuing the victims.
Islamic fundamentalists kidnap two civilians, then kill them by cutting their throats.   They place a bomb under one of the bodies that kills an investigating medical worker.
Sunni extremists attack a checkpoint with automatic weapons and rockets, killing six Iraqi guardsmen.
Insurgents drop a mortar on a soccer field, killing two children and injuring another eight.
Palestinian militants fire a rocket into a residential area, killing two, including a 3-year-old boy.  The murdered child's mother was among a dozen injured.
Palestinian sniper guns down a 63-year-old Israel truck driver.  Arafat's al-Aqsa takes credit.
Extremists cite Qur'anic verses then attack a police station with assault rifles, killing an officer and a civilian.
Muslim terrorists on motorcycles shoot a Buddhist policeman to death as he is driving to work.
al-Jazeera airs a videotape of a U.S. hostage being executed by al-Qaeda.
Islamists kill a schoolteacher with a grenade.
One man was killed and twenty-six others, including five children, were injured by two Taliban bombs hidden in fruit carts.
A convert to Christianity (and father of four daughters) is dragged out of his home by the Taliban, who then slit his throat.
Two civilians are murdered by the Mujahideen.
Muslim separatists kill a police informer and, in a separate attack, shoot a food vendor several times in the back.
Two civilians are killed, and three badly injured, as Sunni extremists detonate a bomb near a hospital.
Three civilians are killed as they pass over a bomb in their vehicle.
Two policemen are killed, and one injured, as the were attempting to arrest the terrorists behind the 6/23 attacks that left over ninety people dead.
Pakistani-backed Islamic militants bomb a string of police cars, killing at least five and injuring over fifteen.
Two citizens are killed, and more than sixty injured by two Islamist planted bombs, hidden handcarts, near a tourist center.
Seven Iraqi National Guardsmen are gunned down at a checkpoint by Sunni extremists.
Third woman dies from injuries sustained in the Taliban grenade attack against election workers.
Three people, including a woman are killed, and seven injured when armed militants fire on a passenger bus.
Fedayeen "holy warrior" suicide car bombing leaves three dead.
Palestinian gunmen stop a car, confirm that the occupants are Jewish civilians, then open up with automatic weapons, killing a man and injuring his wife.
Fourteen mourners at a funeral for a man killed by terrorists are themselves victims of a Fedayeen suicide car bombing.  Dozens of others are injured.
Extremists fire mortars at the residence of the new Iraqi Prime Minister, injuring six.
Bangladeshi terrorists kill a policeman (father of two) returning to the station after patrol.
al-Qaeda use a residential neighborhood as a staging area for firing mortars, killing five U.S. soldiers and two Iraqis.
Taliban ambush kills six Afghan soldiers and injures another four.
An Iraqi civilian and two policemen are shot at point-blank range after their car is stopped by extremists.
A hospital worker is murdered by Islamists.
An American journalist of Forbes magazine is assassinated by Islamic separatists.
A village elder, who opposed Jihadist attempts to recruit young men, was executed by them.  Jihad terrorist attacks also killed ten others (mostly Russian servicemen).
The Taliban continues to target women who work to register voters for the election.  One is killed in the blast, and two others badly injured.
Sunni militants kill a child and injure three others in a mortar attack on a hotel.
Thirty-four people are injured when a militant Muslim tosses a grenade onto a crowded road.
Islamists bomb five shops selling alcohol.  A passing taxi driver is killed in one of the explosions.
Three members of a Palestinian "resistance" group (billing itself as non-violent) are killed when the bomb they are transporting goes off earlier than expected.  A passerby is also killed.
The Mujahideen murder the wife of a police officer.
In a particularly senseless attack, Islamic fundamentalists enter the home of a Christian family and stab two girls (ages 16 and 6) to death.
A woman waiting for a bus is murdered in an al-Fatah bombing.  Thirty-four others are injured.  The bomb was packed with metal bolts.
Five people, including a 12-year-old boy are killed in a packed marketplace by a Taliban terrorist bombing.  More than thirty others are injured.
Islamic separatists kill two more civilians in southern Thailand.
Jihad fighters kill eight Chechen security personnel and take another dozen hostage.  Hostages are typically executed after a reading from the Qur'an.
Moro Islamic Front members kill two farmers on their land with automatic weapons.
Two children die of injuries suffered from an al-Qaeda attack in the west Pakistani mountains.
Regional Shiite political leader is assassinated by extremists.
Taliban members attack and burn a district police headquarters, killing four and injuring five.

Arab militia, supported by the Islamic government's fixed-wing aircraft raid a village and kill one-hundred and fifty civilians, including six children.  The children were captured during the assault and burned alive the next day.
Another raid by armed Arab militias leave eighty villagers dead - including children - and their homes burned to the ground.
Islamic terrorists kill three construction workers and injure another in a senseless terrorist attack on a road-building project.
Militant Muslims kill two persons and injure twelve in a street bombing.
Jihad terrorists attempt to assassinate the acting President in a motorcade bombing, killing a guard and injuring three others.
al-Qaeda militants execute a Bulgarian truck driver that they had taken hostage.
Muslim motorcycle attack kills a police officer as he is driving to work.  Another is injured.
Ten people, mostly civilians, are killed and more than forty injured when a Fedayeen suicide car bomber detonates his explosives along a busy road.
Militants ambush a car carrying a government official, killing three.
A Christian is beaten to death for studying the Bible.
Islamic militant kills two policeman with a grenade and injures a third.
Ten Iraqis, including seven civilians are killed in a Fedayeen car bombing.  Another twenty-seven innocents are injured.
Three civilians are killed, and four others suffer injury after an al-Qaeda attack on a fortified structure.
Fedayeen bomber blows himself to Allah, taking the lives of two people and injuring another twenty-two who were waiting in line for jobs.
'Jihad and Unification' terrorist group uses a car bomb to kill four and injure seven in an attempted assassination of an Iraqi minister.
The Taliban fire a rocket into the city center, killing a woman and injuring a man.
Taliban terrorists fire a rocket into the city, killing a local.
A political figure is assassinated in a drive-by shooting.  His 7-year-old son was shot as well, but survived.
Radical Muslims fire into a church service, killing a female pastor and injuring four Christian worshippers.
A woman is murdered in her home by Islamic radicals.
Islamic terrorists blow up a bus stop, killing two civilians and injuring five more.
Islamists kill the Christian owner of a restaurant selling food to Americans.  They also blind and cut off both hands of his Muslim business partner.
Religious fanatic kills himself and nine others by blowing up a truck filled with fuel on a busy street.  Sixty-two others are injured, including many who are badly burned.
Six people, including two women were killed, and more than fifty others sustained injuries when Muslim terrorists attacked a political rally with grenades.
Islamic gunmen enter a church and kill the female pastor and a 17-year-old girl.  Three other teenage worshipers were also shot.
Arafat's al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade takes credit for killing an Israeli judge at close range as he was driving home.
Sunni extremists assassinate a council member, along with two others.
Islamists wipe out five members of a family, after invading their home in the middle of the night.  Two women and a 3-year-old boy were among those murdered.
Hezbollah snipers kill two IDF members as they are repairing an antennae.
Lashkar-e-Taiba militants kill four policemen as they are investigating a previous crime in a remote village.
Eleven more villagers killed by an Arab militia supported by the Islamic government.
Taliban ambush a convoy of cars with rockets.  Eleven are killed.
At least four people, including three brothers are killed by a car bombing.  Fourteen others are injured.
Muslim insurgents car bomb a residential neighborhood, killing at least three and hurting at least two others.
Sunni extremists fire a missile into a hospital, killing two.
A Christian is stabbed to death by the Taliban over praying in the name of Jesus.
A civilian is killed in a marketplace bombing by Islamic separatists.
al-Qaeda members kill a Bulgarian truck driver, taken hostage several weeks earlier, by cutting off his head.
al-Aqsa militants shoot a 16-year old boy to death and injure other three members of his family who object to the terrorists using their backyard for launching missiles into Israel.
Bus bombing kills at least one and injures seven.  Bus was carrying teachers and an electrician.
Group calling itself 'Lion of God' takes an Egyptian hostage.  Elsewhere gunmen stage an assassination attempt that kills two bodyguards.
Islamic militants thought responsible for a bombing that leaves one person dead.
Islamists kill a man and injure his wife with a bomb.
al-Qaeda attack on a remote border post leaves two dead.
Three cannery workers are killed, and another wounded in a terrorist bombing on their vehicle.
Militant Muslims invade a home and cut off the heads of a 65-year-old man and his two children, one a teenage girl.  They attempt to cut the head off his wife, but she survives the attack.
One citizen is killed, and nearly thirty others injured when militant Muslim throws grenade into the street outside a hospital.
Muslim extremists open fire on a private vehicle carrying workers.  Two women are killed and another three injured.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills three, including two civilians and causes another five to suffer critical burns.
Police recover the body of a woman abducted by Lashkar-e-Toiba terrorists.  Her husband had also been killed by the same group.
The Taliban bombs an election station at a mosque, killing six workers and injuring two.
Fedayeen militants kill five Indian security force personnel and injure two in an attack on a resort.
Group calling itself the 'Islamic Army' brutally executes two Pakistani civilians taken hostage.
Islamic militants kill a police officer at sunrise.
A married father is stabbed to death after being discovered associating with other Christians.
Two police officers are murdered in a landmine attack by Muslim separatists.
An Islamist kills himself and sixty-eight others, including twenty-one passengers on a passing bus, and injures dozens more in a suicide bombing at a marketplace.
Four policemen are killed by a homemade bomb while on routine patrol.
Mujahideen invade a home, kill a mother and father and injure their young child in the process.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills six and injures at least twenty-five others.  Pakistani finance minister was the target.
Three suicide bombers kill three others and injure five in synchronized attacks on the U.S and Israeli embassies.
Hard-line fundamentalists bomb car dealership, killing two people.
Muslim gunmen on motorcycles shoot a 39-year-old woman four times in the chest.  In a separate attack, a bomb hidden under a street bench, injures five.
A local Afghan official and four bodyguards are shot to death by the Taliban.
Three children are blown up by a bicycle bomb placed by religious extremists.
Islamists use automatic weapons at point-blank range to ambush a car carrying soldiers and civilians, killing six.
Terrorist bombing near a hotel kills two civilians and badly injures two others.
A suicide bomber kills at least four people and injures between thirty and fifty in a residential neighborhood.
Islamic radicals bomb five Catholic churches, murdering nearly a dozen Christians and injuring close to one-hundred people.
Bombing by the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat leaves three security company employees dead and one critically injured.
al-Qaeda members place a hood over the head of a cleaner taken hostage, then shoot him three times while praising Allah.
Palestinian terrorists shoot three suspected informants to death in their hospital beds.
Attempted bombing of an Israeli bulldozer backfires.  Three Palestinian bystanders are killed and ten others, including journalists, are injured.
Two al-Qaeda gunmen shoot an Irish engineer four times in the chest at his office.
Suicide bomber kills four Iraqi National Guardsmen at a roadside checkpoint.  Six others are injured.
Taliban radicals ambush and murder two charity workers.
Shopkeeper is brutally beaten to death by members of a Muslim family upset over the presumed "taboo" relationship between his son and their Pakistani daughter.
Fundamentalists bomb two cinemas, killing a 13-year-old boy.
Islamic extremists kill five policemen in a shooting attack followed minutes later by a suicide minibus bombing.
Muslim terrorists attack a police building in the heart of Srinagar, killing eight officers.
Gunmen stop a truck convoy and kill a Turkish father of three who is unable to recite prayers on command.
Suspected Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists invade a woman's home and kill her in cold blood.
The Taliban kill two humanitarian election workers and take another hostage in an attack on their convoy.
Two police officers manning a checkpoint are cut to pieces by Islamists with automatic weapons.
Islamic gunmen fire into a building, killing a police officer.
Islamic radicals murder a 40-year-old 'well-educated' man for converting to Christianity.
Roadside bomb kills a 7-year-old child and injures three others.
Two local security guards are shot to death by Islamic fundamentalists.
A 10-year-old boy is killed, and sixteen others, including a 13-year-old girl, badly injured when Sunnis mortar-bomb a pickup truck in a residential neighborhood.
Two bombs, staggered to cause maximum casualties, rip through a Pakistani restaurant near a Sunni school leaving at least eight dead and dozens injured.
Civilian minibus is the target of another Fedayeen bombing.  Four are killed and four injured.
In another case of "killing for Allah," a Fedayeen suicide bomber destroys seven Iraqi policemen and injures another fourteen people.
Jihadis use a landmine to kill a policeman.
MILF terrorists murder three farmers in a rocket attack.
Islamic insurgents spray a car with machine-gun fire, killing four occupants, including a woman and child.
Unsuccessful suicide car bombing at an Israeli checkpoint kills two Palestinians and injures sixteen.
Muslim terrorists bomb a busy marketplace in a small town, killing six people and injuring at least 10 others.
Mujahideen abduct and later shoot dead two civilians from a remote village.
Palestinian gunman murders an Israeli driver outside a settlement.
Mujahideen terrorists shoot a young couple to death as they beg for their lives.
Iranian Mullah publicly hangs a 16-year-old girl for having a 'sharp tongue.'
Bus station bombed with mortars - at least one killed and five injured.
Taliban extremists attack an Afghan army post and kill six soldiers.
Mortar attack kills two civilians and injures four.  In the same city, a roadside bomb kills three Iraqi Guardsmen.
Two separate terrorist attacks staged by Muslim rebels leave a civilian and two anti-terrorist agents dead.
Islamic insurgents fire a mortar round into a crowded street outside a barbershop, killing six, including two children, and injuring at least thirty others.
Two Algerian village guards are killed by Islamic fundamentalists in separate bombings.
Islamic separatists invade a family's home and then massacre the father, his daughter and two sons.
Mujahideen militants - led by a Pakistani national - abduct and then cut off the heads of a man and his son.
Muslim mob takes 26-year-old Christian from his home then tortures him to death.
Radical Shiites kill eight and injure thirty in the Holy City of Najaf in a mortar attack on a police station.
Seven people are hurt when the Taliban detonate several bombs inside an electoral commission building.
Islamic radicals kill a high-ranking security official.
Sixty-six people, including policemen and other civilians are killed in several terrorist attacks by Muslim separatists in the capital city and across the country.
Nineteen people are killed and over 300 injured when Islamists throw more than a dozen grenades into an opposition political rally.
Fedayeen suicide bomber attempts a political assassination.  Two guards are killed.
Seven security force members are killed in an ambush by Islamic fundamentalists, who lured them by setting fire to a children's center.  Several children were injured.
Eleven Yemeni soldiers are killed in an ambush by followers of a radical Shiite cleric in that country.
'Holy Warrior' suicide bombers kill themselves and five others in twin blasts.  More than a dozen Iraqi civilians are injured.
Four civilians are gunned down by the Mujahideen, two at a picnic spot and two others in Pulwama, after abducting them from their homes.

Militant Muslims hijack two Russian passenger airliners, then murder all eighty-nine people, including women and children on board the two planes.  The terrorist group Islambouli Brigade claims responsibility.
In a heinous attack, a Muslim "freedom fighter" hurls a grenade at two children in a remote village, killing the 3-year-old girl and her 5-year-old brother.
Muslim separatists bomb a food market, killing one and injuring at least thirty others.
Two members of the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat sneak up to two guards at a beach.  They shoot one to death and severely injure another, along with a female bather.
Arab militia, supported by the Islamic government, burn down an African village and kill sixty-four civilians.  Some one-hundred and fifty-six others survive with injuries.
Clashes between supporters of rival Shiite clerics results in at least seventy-five deaths and more than three-hundred injuries.
A Christian man is murdered by Muslim terrorists.
Two civilians, including a child, are killed in a bombing attack.
In a crime so barbaric that even al-Jazeera declined to air the video, an Italian journalist, pacifist, and father of two is taken hostage and murdered by an Islamic group.
A bomb planted by the Taliban at a school kills nine children and one adult.  Fifteen other youngsters were injured in the attack.
The Taliban kill at least nine people, including one child with a remote-controlled truck bomb on a busy street in the capitol city.
Six police officers manning a checkpoint are gunned down by Islamic terrorists in two minibuses.
Three are killed and ten injured by a bomb planted near a food stand.
Three young Christian women are slaughtered by Islamic extremists in a small Iraqi village.
Muslim militant hurls a grenade into a road, killing a school teacher and injuring twenty-six other people.
Hamas (Islamic Resistance) suicide bombers murder sixteen people, including a 3-year-old child riding two passenger buses.  About one-hundred others are injured in the explosions.
A female suicide bomber kills eleven rush-hour commuters at a subway station in Moscow.  Fifty-one others are injured.
An Islamist group called Jaish Ansar al-Sunna slowly beheads a Nepali hostage while eleven other hostages are shot through the back of the head in front of a Qur'anic banner.
At least sixteen people are killed as Mujahideen terrorists invade a school, taking more than a hundred children hostage.  Children are made to stand in windows with suicide bombers behind them.
A 43-year-old Christian man is killed by Jihadists just after leaving a hospital where he was treated for injuries following an earlier attack.
Islamic terrorists gun down two Christian brothers, known for advocating the rights of minorities.
Mujahideen kill a young boy and injure three members of his family for their refusal to send the boy to a terrorist training camp.
The Tawhid wal Jihad (Unity and Holy War ) Islamic group forces three Turkish hostages to kneel before a video camera, then shoots each in the chest.

Islamic militants shoot fleeing children in the back, then blow them up, along with their mothers and teachers with nail-packed bombs.  Others are crushed or burned to death from the effects of the bombs.  More than three-hundred  innocents slaughtered.
Two people, including a teenager are killed by a bomb, placed by the Taliban under a truck.
Islamists shoot and kill a hospital employee in a drive-by.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills at least fifteen people and injures another forty with a car bomb.
Islamic extremists walk up to a police car and shoot three officers to death.
Seven U.S. Marines and three Iraqis are killed by a Fedayeen ('Holy Warrior') suicide car bomber who plowed right into their convoy.
Three Iraqis are killed by a roadside bomb.

At least nine are killed when the Jemaah Islamiyah terrorist group detonates a suicide car bomb outside the Australian embassy in a business district.  More than one-hundred and seventy others are treated for injuries.
Suspected Harkat-ul-Jehadi-e-Islami members abduct a 52-year-old man from his orchard, then march him to the top of a nearby hill where he is executed.
Two are killed, and one injured when militants bomb a State-run space research center.
Two Sunni gunmen on a motorcycle kill a prominent Shiite academic as he is driving home.
Suicide attack on a heavily-guarded tourist hotel leaves three security personnel dead and seven others injured.
Mujahideen militants toss a grenade into a crowded marketplace, killing one civilian and injuring twenty others.
In a senseless attack, terrorists kill three Polish sappers who were working to clear the country of landmines.
Two people, including a seminary teacher are killed in Muslim sectarian violence.
Group "Unification and Jihad" beheads a Turkish truck driver in front of a video camera.  Elsewhere, two Italian women are taken hostage.
Lashker-e-Toiba members, invade a house, torture three family members with sharp instruments, then shoot them to death.
Two Canadian (Arab) Christians are chased by a mob of Muslims and beaten to death.

A Fedayeen suicide bomber fervently practices his religion by killing himself and forty-seven others in a car bombing on a busy street next to a line of police recruit hopefuls.  Over one-hundred others are injured in the attack.
Sunni insurgents spray a police van, carrying officers and civilians, with automatic weapons, killing twelve and injuring three.
Two Iraqi workers are ambushed and shot to death in Kirkuk.  A car bombing in Baghdad kills two and injures ten.  Three Western civilians there are also kidnapped.
British man gunned down by terrorists in the parking lot of a shopping center.
The headless bodies of three people, two of who were Assyrian Christians, are found in a field with Qur'anic inscriptions carved into them.
Islamic fundamentalist plant a bomb that kills four village guards.
A Buddhist judge is shot to death by Muslim gunmen after dropping his children off at school.
Fedayeen suicide bomber murders eight people in a shopping district.  Forty-one others survive with injuries.
A cleric is gunned down by Muslim radicals.
A Christian convert from Islam has his throat slashed by Muslim fundamentalists.
Nineteen people waiting in line for jobs are blown to bits by a Fedayeen suicide car bomber.
Gunmen pull beside two cars carrying oil executives.  Five are shot to death, four wounded.
Armed Islamic extremists set up a fake road block on a remote road.  They shoot to death four people that stop there and also abduct a woman.
Three young Kurdish party members are captured by 'Ansar al-Sunna' terrorists and beheaded.  Elsewhere, a suicide car bombing kills three.
Armed Nigerian militants, shouting 'Allahu Akbar' invade two towns and kill ten people, including seven civilians.
Taliban militants stop a taxi carrying three unarmed Afghan soldiers (out of uniform).  They pull them out of the car and behead all three on the side of the road.
Two American civilians are beheaded on videotape by an al-Qaeda group called 'Jihad and Unification.'
Three members of a Shia family are slaughtered in a sectarian attack.  One young girl survived with injuries.
Six people are murdered by an Islamic suicide bomber outside a photocopy shop.  Nearly sixty others are admitted to the hospital.
A government employee is killed by Islamic terrorists.
Two people are killed in a Mujahideen automatic-weapons attack on their vehicle.
Palestinian gunmen attempt to infiltrate a Jewish settlement.  They are stopped by Israeli troops, but manage to kill three.
Jihad militants mortar bomb a city street, killing three civilians and injuring fourteen.  Elsewhere, six Egyptian mobile-phone company workers are kidnapped.
Palestinians fire a mortar into a Jewish residential neighborhood, killing a 22-year-old woman.
Nine Afghan soldiers are killed by Taliban militants who ambush their SUV convoy.
Islamists shoot a French resident to death as he is walking to his car in a supermarket parking lot.
Lashkar-e-Jhangvi radicals ambush a policeman near his home, killing him and two others.
Victim of the 9/22 grenade attack - a man waiting for a bus - succumbs to his injuries.
Heavily-armed Mujahideen attack a village, burning residences and badly injuring an 8-year-old girl and at least one other.
In a tragic and senseless attack, Islamic insurgents kill murder six young men in a minivan who had just signed up as police recruits.
Four Russian police are killed at a traffic stop by Jihad terrorists.
Islamic separatists kill the owner of a fruit orchard.  Elsewhere, a grenade attack leaves nine injured.
A local official is killed and three other people injured when the Taliban attacks their vehicle in a remote area.
A judge is gunned down by Jihadis.
al-Qaeda militants use an IED to kill three Pakistani soldiers riding in a convoy.
Two explosions, at least one a Fedayeen suicide bombing, is responsible for the deaths of seven Iraqi Guardsmen in Fallujah and Mosul.
Muslims use motorbikes to stage two shooting attacks that leave a government official and one police officer dead.
Abu Sayyaf terrorists shoot two policemen to death as they ride by on a motorcycle.
Shia gunmen prevent the rescue of two injured British soldiers, who later die from wounds suffered in a terrorist ambush.
Islamic fundamentalists slaughter six civilian village defense force volunteers.
Islamic gunmen ambush a police vehicle, killing one officer.
Islamic militants are thought responsible for a grenade attack on a residential area that kills a child.
An Islamic insurgent car bombing kills four civilians and injures at least sixteen others.
Muslim militants shoot a government official and bodyguard to death as they are waiting at a traffic light.
Taliban terrorists attack a government post, killing twelve Afghan soldiers.
Palestinian gunmen kill a female jogger - and the medic trying to save her life.

At least fifty people, including thirty-five children are killed by a series of car bombings.  More than two-hundred others are injured.  The main target was a ceremony marking the opening of a new sewage system.
Two small children (ages 2 and 4) are killed by a Palestinian rocket while playing in the front yard of their home.  Hamas (Islamic Resistance) claims responsibility.
A homemade al-Qaeda bomb kills four teenagers between the ages of 15 and 18.
Sunni suicide bomber kills at least thirty-one worshippers at a Shia mosque.  More than fifty others injured in the blast.
Pro-Syrian terrorists use a car bomb in an attempted political assassination.
Grenade attack injures three civilians and one policeman.  A civilian later dies of injuries (10/6/04)
Islamists tie a man up and cut off his head.  Another hostage, female, is shot through the head.  Both bodies dumped in the same area.
Three suicide car bombings, two in Baghdad and one in Mosul, kill at least twenty-four and injure nearly one-hundred.  The casualties are mostly civilians as the attacks occurred on city streets.
Jihadists kidnap and then behead a 15-year-old Christian boy.  They then burn his body.
Sunni car bombing kills four and injures at least two.
Jihadists kill three more hostages by means of decapitation.  Bodies found with hands bound.
Ten policemen are killed by Jihad fighters in three separate attacks.  One is bound and beheaded.
Ansar al-Sunna radicals kill four Kurds in a shooting attack on their minivan.
The Taliban plant a bomb in a car, killing six civilians.
Islamists gun down a policeman standing guard at a market.
A series of attacks by Islamic militants leaves two government workers dead.
The Taliban kills two people with a bomb at an election rally.  Five others sustain injuries.
Suicide bomber blows himself to Allah, taking twelve Iraqi Guardsmen at a checkpoint with him.  Twenty-five others are injured.
Taliban militants kill seven Afghan policemen with a landmine.
Two constables are killed outside a mosque in a shooting attack by Islamists.
Forty-one Sunnis are targeted by rival Shiites in two car bomb blasts as the victims are holding a rally.
Two explosions kills three Israelis and one Egyptian.  "Brotherhood of International Islamists" takes responsibility.

At least thirty-three people, most of them Jewish tourists, are killed by a massive suicide car bombing at an Egyptian resort hotel.  About one-hundred and fifty others are among the injured.  Several Muslim groups scramble to claim responsibility.
In front of a banner proclaiming "One God and Jihad" kidnappers slice the head off of a 62-year-old British engineer.
Three police officers are killed by the Nigerian 'Taliban.'  Twelve others were taken prisoner.
An Islamic extremist group plants a bomb outside the Indonesian embassy in Paris, injuring ten.
Muslims kill a 38-year old Buddhist soldier with an assault rifle as he is walking home.
In another motorcycle attack, Muslims shoot a 23-year old Buddhist student to death.
Jaish-e-Mohammad militants use a suicide car bombing against a mini-bus, killing five and injuring some forty-five civilians and soldiers.
Two Sunni clerics are gunned down by Shia terrorists in the street.
A militant Shiite group called Ali-Ilahi opens fire on a police station.
A suicide bomber walks up to a Shiite mosque and kills a young boy and two guards who intercepted him before he could kill other worshippers.
Two suicide bombers kill at least eleven (mostly Iraqi women) and injure sixteen.
Two civilians and one American soldier are killed in a Fedayeen suicide car bombing.
A policeman is murdered by Islamic militants.
Two people are brutally gunned down by Islamists while shopping at a market.
Muslim gunmen storm a police station with firearms and grenades.  An officer and a civilian are killed.
Ansar al-Sunnah takes a Shiite hostage then cuts off his head on video.
Islamist throws a grenade at a wedding party in an Afghan refugee camp, because they were listening to music, which was forbidden under the Taliban.
Suicide car bombing leave two U.S. soldiers dead and five injured.
A 23-year-old is killed by the Mujahideen.  Elsewhere in the district a mother and her son are abducted.  Their fate is unknown.
Sword-wielding Muslim mob kills two Christians on a busy street in an Indonesian province.  One dies at the scene, another at the hospital.
Lashkar Jihad gunmen kill a Hindu woman and injure two Christian men by opening fire on their houses.
Muslim invaders kill a Hindu husband and wife in their home.
Uzbeki militants affiliated with an Islamic terror cell kidnap two Chinese engineers and execute one.
A female reporter, Iraqi judge and two South African civilian contractors are murdered in three separate shooting attacks.  A Chinese hostage is also shot to death by al-Qaeda terrorists..
A suicide bomber kicks off the Muslim holy month of Ramadan by killing five civilians at a cafe.  Eighteen others are injured.
Small Christian girl kidnapped and killed by Muslims who had demanded ransom from her family.
The Taliban sets a truck on fire, then detonates a remote-controlled bomb after a crowd gathers.  Three children are among the dead.
Jihad car bombing kills four palm grove laborers and a family of four that was passing by in a car.  Two other bystanders were killed as well.
An Assyrian Christian is beaten and killed by Muslim attackers, who then mutilate his body and dump it in the Christian quarter of town.  A friend coming to help is shot and killed.
Suicide car bomber kills one civilian and three Americans.
Jihadists ambush a minivan carrying nine police recruits traveling from Jordan.  All are shot to death.
The Mujahideen detonate a car-bomb outside a hospital, killing at least one person.
Car bombing near a cafe kills six and injures twenty-six.  Police and civilians among the casualties.
An Islamic terrorist lobs a grenade at a village defense committee trying to guard a bus station.
The Mujahideen kill a 22-year-old man and badly injure five members of his family who were trying to prevent his murder.
Religious fundamentalists kill five, including an election worker, in a landmine attack.
Three security officials are killed in an attack by the same religious fundamentalists that recently massacred eleven Chinese workers.
Jihadists behead two Macedonian hostages on video.  They also kill four Iraqi Guardsmen standing in formation and injure more than eighty with a mortar attack.
Islamic insurgents kill four children with a car bomb.  Twenty others are injured.
An election official is murdered by the Taliban, who injure his two sons as well.
Muslim gunmen kill the security guard at a Catholic church.
Two women and their driver are shot to death by Muslim insurgents as they are driving to work.
Islamists stage a shooting ambush a bus carrying airline workers, killing four women, and injuring at least eleven others.
The Mujahideen assassinate a prominent moderate politician and critically injure his bodyguard.
Armed Islamic extremists stop cars carrying young people to a soccer game at a phony roadblock.  They then use knives and small-arms to kill sixteen.  Thirteen others are missing.
Muslim zealot kills ten policemen and injures forty-eight people in a powerful suicide bombing.
A Taliban extremist straps six grenades to his body then detonates them on a city street, killing a 12-year-old Afghan girl and an American woman.
Mujahideen terrorists invade a home.  They shoot two members of a family to death and kidnap another member, whom they later behead.
Armed Islamists kill a security guard and injure a civilian in eastern Algeria.

A very heinous attack by "Unification and Jihad" leaves forty-eight unarmed police recruits dead.  Their three minibuses were stooped by the Jihadists, who forced the men out by the side of the road and executed each with a shot to the head.
Mujahideen attempt another political assassination at a funeral.  A passerby is killed in the mine attack.
An Assyrian Christian woman, mother of three children, is murdered in her home by Jihad warriors.
A series of Fedayeen suicide bombings in Mosul and Baghdad kill six Iraqi civilians and leave at least a dozen injured.
al-Qaeda kill nine tribesmen with rockets in western Pakistan.  At least five others are critically injured.
Algerian Islamists kill five more people at fake roadblocks in two remote areas.  Three are beheaded.
The Mujahideen invade another house and kill two teenagers, including an 18-year-old girl.
A vicious killing by Islamists, who barge into a Christian charity office, tie up six men, then execute six by shooting them in the back of the head.
Local Muslims gun down a Buddhist orchard owner and bomb a bar.  The bomb kills two people and injures twenty others.

Eleven Iraqi Guardsmen are taken hostage by Ansar al-Sunnah.  All eleven are bound and then executed, some with a shot to the head others with a slow beheading.  The killers admonish the video audience to "Repent to Allah."
A remote-controlled bomb is set off by Islamic extremists near a tea shop, killing one person and injuring twenty-four others.
Two Muslim clerics are killed by the other's followers in a religious dispute.  Woman and two young girls injured.
'Holy Warrior' suicide car bomber kills eight U.S. Marines and injures ten others on routine patrol.
Fedayeen car bombing on an Arabic TV station leaves seven dead and nineteen badly injured.
Mujahideen assassinate a politician and his 12-year-old son after invading their home.  The dead boy's mother is severely injured in the attack.
The Janjaweed attack an African village earlier in the month, killing eighteen civilians and injuring another six.
Jihadists fire a rocket at a hotel, killing fifteen civilians and injuring eight others.
Qur'anic quoting militants bound a Japanese hostages arms then cut off his head.
Muslim separatists kill a Buddhist construction worker, a police officer, two agricultural workers, and one other civilian.
Two high-ranking government officials are assassinated in separate ambushes.
Two Jewish women and a man are murdered at a cheese deli in an open market by a 16-year-old who let the Abu Ali Mustafa terrorist network strap explosives to his chest.
Harkat-ul-Ansar terrorist hurls a grenade into a busy market, injuring over twenty people.
A Christian family is ambushed in their car by Muslim gunmen, who manage to kill the father and his 10-year-old son.
Muslim agitators murder a 58-year-old Buddhist village chief by cutting off his head.
Terrorists kill six people outside a Ministry of Education building with a car bombing.
Dutch filmmaker (Grandnephew of painter Van Gogh) shot to death by a 26-year-old Moroccan after making a film critical of Islam.
Shia gunmen open fire on a Sunni mosque, killing one and injuring two.
Four more Iraqis kidnapped and beheaded.
The Mujahideen kidnap and decapitate the Christian leader of an Indonesian village.
Muslim terrorists kill nine Buddhists over a 24-hour period in separate attacks.  At least one monk survived with injuries, as well as a young boy.
Four civilians are killed by a homemade Taliban bomb as they were passing by in their vehicle.
'Holy Warrior' suicide bomber kills three British soldiers manning a checkpoint, along with their translator.
Car bombing kills three Iraqis and injures seven.
Jihadists kill a 3-year-old boy and a 12-year-old girl with a rocket.
Algerian Islamists ambush and kill two policemen.  The fundamentalists have killed about thirty civilians thus far during Ramadan.
Thirty-four people, mostly civilians, are blown up by Fedayeen suicide bombers [looking to curry favor with Allah] in several coordinated attacks.
Two Buddhists, one a grocery store owner, are gunned down by militant Muslims.
Mujahideen terrorists throw a grenade at two off-duty soldiers shopping in a retail district, killing them and injuring two civilians.
Two Scottish civilians are killed by Shia militants.  One of them is a father of two.
Laskar Jihad terrorists kill the driver of a public minibus.
Muslim extremists bomb two Christian churches, killing three and injuring over forty, including women and children.
Ansar al-Islam terrorists set two tanker trucks on fire, burning the Turkish drivers alive.  Elsewhere, four Iraqi civilians are killed when gunmen ambush their car and set it on fire.
Car bombing kills two British and South African civilians.
Jihadists car bomb the emergency unit of a hospital, killing thirteen civilians and injuring at least sixty.
Taliban extremists machine-gun Afghan soldiers at a checkpoint, killing three and injuring two.
A teacher is murdered by terrorists.
Islamic terrorists set off a car-bomb on a city street, killing two civilians.
Local Islamists are tied to the burned bodies of seven missing persons.
The Mujahideen stage an attack on the home of a politician.  A neighbor and a security guard are killed.
Thai Muslims cut the head off of a 60-year-old Buddhist plantation worker.
Group calling itself the "Islamic Secret Army" takes five civilians hostage to use as human shields, then summarily executes them when no longer needed.
A Fedayeen blows himself to Allah, taking at least nineteen people with him that happened to be passing by on a packed city street.  Women and children are among the victims.
Sunni gunmen kill two American civilians in an ambush.
A Buddhist teacher is gunned down by Islamic militants.  They also plant a bomb in a restaurant, which injures fourteen.
A 30-year-old computer worker is brutally assaulted and slain by three Pakistanis.
Muslim terrorists kill five and injure four with a bomb hidden on a public bus.  Two of the dead are women.
Armed fundamentalists kill two Algerian soldiers in separate terror attacks.
The Mujahideen invade two houses, killing the wife of one occupant.  The owner of the other house is kidnapped and then has his throat slit.
Militant Muslims explode a bomb in the middle of a marketplace, killing one person instantly and leaving at least six others critically injured.
Muslims gun down two civilians - one in his home and another who happened on the attack.
Palestinian extremists kill two people guarding the new PA leader.  Six bystanders are wounded.
Three people, including a husband and wife, are burned to death when the Mujahideen set fire to their home.
Jaish-e-Mohammed militants kill three policemen assigned to protect a minority Indian ethnic group after a horrific massacre last year.
Two civilians are gunned down by the Mujahideen while collecting wood in a forest.
Body of a Polish female kidnapped by Islamists is found.  Her throat had been slit and she had been disemboweled with a knife.  She was identified by her long blond hair.
Militants attack a home, killing a retired man and a teenage family member.
The Taliban attack a remote outpost near a hydro-power dam, killing six guards.
Hindu minority leader gunned down in his home.
A 59-year-old humanitarian aid worker, kidnapped by Islamists last month, is executed on video with a bullet to the back of her head.
Militant Muslims invade a residence and kill six members of a family, including two women.
The Taliban kill four policemen in a landmine attack.  Six others are injured.
24-year-old Christian man is attacked by Muslim activists, badly beaten and left for dead.
Suicide car bomber kills fifteen, including six women and six children.  The attack took place in the middle of a crowded street.
Bomb explodes in the back of a cinema, killing two people and injuring about thirty.
A civilian is killed in a Salafist Group landmine attack.
The Fedayeen kill two women, a man and a child in a bombing attack on their car.
Jihadists kill three Iraqis, including a woman, with a suicide car bombing.  In Balad they kidnap and behead a native contractor.
Synagogue worker gunned down on the streets of Antwerp.
Three people are killed when the Mujahideen bomb their vehicle.
Jemaah Islamiyah set off a bomb on a minibus outside a market, killing five people and injuring five others.
A Bangladeshi man and his two sons stab a 19-year-old to death in his car in an honor killing after an affair with their daughter.
Jihadists chase down a car carrying public works employees on their way to work and machine-gun all four to death.
Nine policemen are captured by Islamists, then murdered with bullets to the back of the head.
Two Iraqi Kurds are captured by Ansar Al-Sunna, tortured for seven days and then executed.
Sunni terrorists kill eight policemen and injure fifteen in a shooting ambush.
Taliban gunmen murder three persons in a shooting attack.
More than thirty civilians, including women and children are killed by the government in a ground attack on their village.  More than a hundred others are raped or injured.
Muslim extremists attack a group of Christian evangelists.  Two people are beaten to death and at least ten others injured.
Muslim militants stage two attacks against border guards, killing three and injuring three.
Suicide car bomber kills at least two civilians, including one woman.
Pakistani Islamists attack a police vehicle, killing two occupants.
Hizb-ul-Mujahideen kill two Hindu travelers on a road, along with a college student dragged of his house.
Attack by Arab militias leaves fifteen African villagers dead and six injured.
Fifteen more bodies of executed hostages are found in Mosul.
Sunni extremists kill three Iraqi and four British civilians with three bombings over a 24-hour period.
An Islamic militant attacks a cafe, killing one person.
In a brutal attack, a civilian is killed and three others injured by members of the Salafi Daawa terrorist group.
Five civilians are killed in a roadside bomb attack by Jihadists.
The Taliban attack an NGO office and machine-gun three aid workers to death.  Three others are injured.
Mujahideen hurl a grenade into the center of a commercial district, injuring a dozen civilians.
Seven policemen, lining up for pay, are killed in a suicide bombing by Sunni extremists.
Chechen Mujahideen hurls two grenades at Pakistani police attempting an arrest.  Ten are injured.
Sixty-five civilians are reported dead after an air force bombing of their village by the Islamic government.  An unknown number are injured.
Two separate shooting attacks by Muslim missionaries from the back of a motorcycle leave a teacher dead and two other civilians injured.
Fedayeen suicide bomber takes four civilians on to Allah with him.  Nineteen others are injured in the attack.
Another suicidal extremist kills one civilian and injures seven others with a car bombing.
Islamic terrorists kidnap and decapitate a 29-year-old Christian man.
Extremists lob an explosive into a house, killing three children and injuring another five.  All of the kids were from the same family.
al-Mansoorain terrorists stage a suicide attack on a police camp.  At least five officers are killed.
Four suicide bombers drive a minibus loaded with explosives into a Shiite mosque.  Fourteen civilians are killed and at least nineteen others critically injured.
al-Qaeda militants attack a police station with RPGs and small arms, killing sixteen officers and injuring five.
A suicide bomber kills two Americans near the Jordanian-Iraqi border.
Jihadis kill a civilian with an IED.
Sunni extremists murder sixteen people and injure thirty-eight with two suicide car bomb blasts on a commercial street in the heart of the city.
Eleven people are blown to bits by the Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist group on a road, while traveling to a security camp.
Islamic insurgents pull aside two buses carrying civilians and open fire at point-blank range, machine-gunning seventeen to death and injuring at least thirteen others.
A public prosecutor is killed by Islamists while working his farm.
The Taliban gun down a police officer in a heinous attack.
al-Qaeda members attack the U.S. consulate in Saudi Arabia with grenades, killing at least five international contractors and injuring several Americans.
One Israeli soldier is killed by a bomb at a border crossing.  Four are others injured.
Muslim separatists murder four civilians, including a teenager in separate attacks that also claim the lives of two Russian soldiers.  Seven others are injured and two taken hostage.
Twenty-one people are injured when Islamic rebels bomb a gas pipeline.
Muslim students at an African university abduct and kill a Christian student.
Islamic terrorists kill a Christian doctor as he is attending to (Muslim) patients in a hospital.
Two American civilians are gunned down by a group calling itself the "Jihad Brigade."
Three Shia election workers are gunned down by Sunni activists.
Sunni insurgents kill four civilians and injure several more with a terrorist bombing in the city center.
Thirty-six people are injured by a grenade thrown by the Mujahideen on a busy street.
Mujahideen murder two cops in an ambush.  Five others are injured.
Three civilians are killed and five injured when Jihadists lob mortar bombs into a residential neighborhood.
Heavily-armed Mujahideen ambush on a police patrol and slaughter all four Indian cops.
Bomb attached to a bicycle rips through a marketplace, killing more than ten people and injuring about two dozen.
Islamic gunmen fire on a civilian vehicle, killing at least one occupant.
Abu Sayyaf gunmen assassinate a government official.
Hamas (Islamic Resistance) lobs several rockets into an Israeli neighborhood.  Four, including three children, are seriously injured.
Muslims open fire on churches in Indonesia, injuring three Christians.
Abu Sayyaf suspected of a mall bombing that kills fifteen Christmas shoppers.  Nearly sixty others are injured.
Five Israeli soldiers are killed when Hamas terrorists set off a bomb under a checkpoint.  Six others hospitalized.
Fedayeen suicide car bomber murders more than a dozen civilians and seriously injures another fifteen in a blast designed to maximize human casualty.
Islamists ambush a security patrol, killing at least one member.
Two policemen manning a checkpoint are cut to pieces by Islamic gunmen.
A Buddhist teacher is gunned down by two Muslims in a motorcycle attack.  His wife is injured.
Wahhabi terrorists attack a government building and kill the four security staff members on duty.
Another Muslim takes his life in a suicide car blast that also kills seven civilians and injures at least thirteen.
Sunni extremists bomb a Shia mosque, eventually killing ten and injuring forty people in the mosque and on the street.
Hamas militants kill a foreign agriculture worker at an Israeli settlement and injure two more with mortars.
Two more Buddhist civilians, both in their 50's, are shot to death by Muslim extremists.  One was selling ice-cream from his vending bike at the time.
Sunni insurgents ambush a police convoy, killing four people on the spot.  Thirteen officers are taken prisoner and subsequently executed.
Muslims gun down a civilian as he is on his way to pick up his wife.
Religious extremists murder four policemen with a car-bomb.
Grisly murder of four men traveling in a car through Mosul (three are foreigners).  Bodies are mutilated and set aflame.
Muslim terrorists shoot and kill a 70-year-old political activist and abduct and kill a youth (Kanir).

Three people are dragged from a car, forced to kneel, and then shot by "holy warriors."  Elsewhere, a husband and wife are shot to death in their homes for supporting "infidels."  (Son is kidnapped as well).
Two Christians are kidnapped and then murdered by Jihadists.
Sixteen people are killed by Fedayeen suicide car bomber and about forty injured in the attack on a Shia holy site.
An Islamic extremist plows his car into a Shia funeral procession and detonates it near a mosque.  Over fifty people are killed and about one hundred and fifty injured in the suicide attack.
Taliban insurgents ambush a security checkpoint, killing four policemen.
Twenty-two people, including several civilians are killed and about seventy injured when an Ansar al-Sunnah terrorist blows himself up in the middle of the lunch hour at a mess hall.
A 39-year-old Israeli woman is stabbed to death by Palestinian terrorists.
A village chief is murdered by Islamists.
One person is killed and fourteen others, mostly civilians are injured when Mujahideen militant hurls a grenade into the road.
Palestinians snatch a rifle from an Israeli guard and then shoot him to death with it.
An explosives-rigged fuel truck detonates in a residential neighborhood, killing nine, including seven members of the same family.  "Shahid" suicide bombing.
Religious fundamentalists finally murder an economics professor on campus after several unsuccessful attempts
Islamic separatists plant a bomb on a motorcycle, outside a bank, and kill two people, injuring at least seven.
Islamic separatists kill two and injure twenty-eight in a grenade attack on a busy street.
Armed fundamentalists kill two employees of an international aid foundation and set fire to vehicles.
Three Thai policemen are killed by Muslims in a motorcycle terror attack as they are passing by.
A 'Holy Warrior' detonates explosives in front of a Shia party headquarters, killing himself and at least fifteen other.  Several dozen are injured, many suffering burns and missing limbs.
Islamic extremists kill a school teacher in front of a market.
Seven Algerian civilians are gunned down by al-Salafeyah extremists.
In two attacks (Tikrit and Baqubah), Jihadists slaughter twelve Iraqi police officers by slitting their throats and murder five National Guardsmen a bomb.
Five civilians are killed by a Sunni car bomb.  About thirty more are injured.
The Mujahideen shoot nine people to death in separate attacks.  One is the leader of the youth wing of a political party.
al-Qaeda members assassinate a local political figure in a drive-by with ties to the Afghan President.
Saudi militants kill one person in two car bomb blasts.
At least twenty-nine, including two dozen civilians are killed when Islamic radicals blow up several houses near one being searched by police with a massive bomb.
A man and his two teenage daughters bleed to death after their throats are cut by Islamic fundamentalists in their home.
A second teacher is gunned down in as many days by Muslim separatists.
Islamic extremists kill a civilian with a car-bomb.
Three people, including a man and his wife, are slaughtered at point-blank range by Islamic gunmen.
Abu Sayyaf terrorists kill a 68-year-old man execution style.
Two citizens are shot dead in their home after the Mujahideen barge in.  Another relative is injured.
Suicide bomber kills seven and injures an unknown number of people.
An off-duty policeman is murdered by Islamic rebels.
Hamas rockets kill a 25-year-old man working in the industrial zone. Two others are injured.
Radical Sunnis machine-gun four cops to death as they sit in their car.
Fedayeen suicide bomber kills twenty-three people, mostly Iraqi National Guardsmen in a terrorist attack.
Ansar al-Sunna Islamists kidnap and decapitate an Iraqi, then booby-trap the headless body with a bomb that kills a police officer.
Three suicide bombers blow themselves to Allah in separate attacks, taking sixteen other souls with them.  Over forty others sustain burns, open wounds and lost limbs.
Algeria's Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat bombs a convoy then rakes it with machine-gun fire, killing eighteen people and injuring an unknown number.
A husband and wife, their son and two other relatives are murdered in their home in an 'honor killing' by a group of armed men.
Muslims murder a Thai village official from the back of a motorcycle as he is driving to work.
Fedayeen 'Holy Warrior' rams a checkpoint with a truck full of explosives, killing ten and injuring at least sixty, including women and children.
Iraqi governor, an advocate for democracy, is gunned down along with six of his guards by Islamic theocrats.
Fedayeen suicide car bomber kills at least twenty outside a police graduation ceremony.  About four dozen others are badly hurt.
A series of Mujahideen attacks across the country leaves seventeen dead, nineteen wounded and six others, including two college students kidnapped.
Four civilians and two Indian police suffer injuries when the Mujahideen hurl a grenade into a city street.
al-Qaeda group sends a suicide bomber into a security point.  Six dead and thirteen injured.
Terrorists assassinate a shop owner in a bloody attack.
The bodies of eighteen Shia laborers abducted and shot execution style by Sunni radicals are unearthed in a field.
An Israeli motorist is killed by a Palestinian sniper.  Three others are injured, two critically.
Fedayeen militants from the al-Mansoorian outfit storm a government building with grenades, leaving at least four dead.
Sunni attack on the vehicle of a Shia cleric leaves two of his guards dead.
An Israeli officer is killed, and three others injured, in a Hezbollah rocket attack along the Lebanese border.
Shia burn six Sunnis alive after herding them into a house in a revenge for an earlier attack on a Shiite leader.
Eight Ukrainian bomb sappers, and one Kazakh are killed by the 'Islamic Army' in a terrorist bombing attack.
Moro Islamic Front stages a surprise attack on government post, killing eight Philippine soldiers.
Islamic gunmen kill two security guards outside a government building.
Fedayeen suicide bombing leave six police dead and a dozen injured.  Police chief also assassinated in Baghdad, along with his son.
A school security guard is murdered by Islamists.
Janjaweed militias murder fifteen villagers in a raid.
Seven Iraqi civilians are killed when militants destroy their minibus with a roadside bomb.
Palestinians use explosives and arms fire to murder an Israeli officer in the process of constructing a security fence.
Six Afghan soldiers are kidnapped and executed by the Taliban.
Mujahideen attack on a government car leaves four civilians dead.
Radical Sunnis shoot a Shia cleric and his son to death on the street, along with four of their bodyguards.
Islamic fundamentalists throw a hand grenade into a cinema showing a soccer game, killing four innocents.
Muslim militants thought responsible for the bombing of a bus station.
Terrorists kill two civilians and severely injure a 5-year-old girl.
Three Palestinian suicide bombers infiltrate the security wall, via an explosion, and murder six Israelis.  Four others are wounded.
A car bomb outside a Shia mosque kills seven people and injures another thirty, some critically.
Islamic gunmen riddle a civilian minivan with machine-gun fire as it is picking up a Turkish businessman.
The Mujahideen enter a civilian's house and kill his 20-year-old daughter.
Al-Mansoorian terrorists storm a passport office and kill two government employees.
Islamic terrorists kill four policemen in two separate shootouts in Dagestan (Kaspiisk & Makhachkala).
Grenade thrown into an election rally by the Mujahideen kills two people and injures seventeen.
Islamic militants set off bombs at two different carnivals killing three and injuring about ninety others, including stage performers.
