Islamic fundamentalists shoot into a group of civilians, killing one.
Muslims stab a Buddhist man multiple times, and eventually kill him by slitting his throat.
Nine civilians are killed by a Fedayeen suicide bomber on a city street.
The Taliban opens fire on a police vehicle, killing an instructor and injuring two others.
A child is among four civilians killed by Taliban extremists in a rocket attack on a convoy of cars.
Sunni insurgents kill a 7-year-old boy by the side of the road with a bomb that also injured nine other pedestrians.
Nine people are injured when a Jaish-e-Mohammed cadre lobs a grenade into a street.
In separate attacks, Islamic fundamentalists kill two people at a coffee house and a nearby market.
Fatah Uprising terrorists kill a Lebanese army contractor.
Muslim militants ambush a vehicle carrying Russians, shooting four to death in the attack.
Two civilians are among three killed by the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat.
Religious fundamentalists slit the throat of a 70-year-old shepherd.
Nine people are killed in a series of attacks by militant Islamists.
Two security personnel are slain in a brutal ambush by Muslim terrorists.
About thirty people are injured when Hizb-ul-Mujahideen target a bus with an IED.
A Shia teacher is gunned down on his way to school by radical Sunnis.
A suicide bomber from Islamic Jihad murders five Israelis in front of a food stand in a public area.
al-Qaeda-linked tribesmen target a military vehicle with a landmine, killing one.
A Mujahideen ambush on a security patrol leaves two dead.
Sectarian violence in the form of a Sunni on Shia ambush claims the lives of fifteen.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills a civilian and injured nine others.
Six members of a family are hacked to death in an honor killing.
Islamic militants disguised as fully-veiled women shoot a local religious leader to death from the back of a motorcycle.
Two men are dragged out a mosque and executed by Taliban extremists.  A tribal leader in nearby Khost is also shot to death.
The Taliban ambush a civilian vehicle, killing two brothers and one of their sons.
Islamic radicals kill a man herding goats.

In a particularly heinous attack, an Islamist suicide bomber disguises an explosives-laden truck as a produce vendor, gathers ordinary customers around it, then detonates, killing at least thirty innocents.
Three Christian 16-year-old girls on their way to school are attacked and beheaded by six Muslim gentlemen, who leave the headless bodies in the street and carry the heads to a different location.

Three coordinated blasts that tear through a bus and two markets crowded with people celebrating a Hindu festival bear all the hallmarks of the Religion of Peace.  An Islamic group claims responsibility.
Jihad attacks on an oil tanker and a construction site kill four laborers and a government driver.
A civilian is abducted and executed by the Mujahideen.
The Mujahideen murder a civilian defense volunteer in his village.
Islamic fundamentalists attack a police patrol in a small town, killing one officer and injuring seven people, including civilians.
Two civilians are shot to death by Islamic fundamentalists.  One was a child.
Fourteen bound and tortured corpses are found in the former Islamist stronghold.  Two were decapitated.
Three Christians are killed by Muslims in unrest following the carrying out of a Sharia sentence of amputation against a Christian.
Four employees working at an oil company are killed in a rocket attack by Jihadis.
Islamists ambush and kill twelve Yemeni policemen as they are traveling through a remote town.
Eighteen shoppers are killed when Islamic insurgents detonate a car bomb in a crowded market area.  About fifty others are injured.
A civilian standing on a city street is gunned down in a suspected Islamist attack.
A cop is gunned down by Jihadis on his way home.
A villager is shot and killed by terrorists in a shooting attack.
A civilian is murdered by Islamists.
Two civilians are abducted by the Mujahideen.  One is strangled.  The other is still missing.
Five Iraqis in a private minibus are killed in a Jihadi roadside bombing attack.
A drug-fighting police unit is surprised by the Taliban, who take five officers prisoner, then cut off their heads.
Jaish-e-Mohammed kill a 10-year-old boy, a woman, and at least eight others with a suicide bombing in a residential neighborhood.
Jihadis use a landmine to kill a member of an engineering squad.
A 32-year-old man is shot to death by Muslim militants as he is riding a motorcycle.
An Israeli soldier is shot in the head by Palestinian gunmen while making an arrest.  Soldiers noticed suspicious movement nearby, but hesitated for fear of hitting civilians.
Twenty-three Shiites are killed when a minibus packed with explosives is detonated next to a mosque and a busy market.
A fisherman is shot to death by Islamic extremists.
Two men are killed in a Jihadi bombing.
Muslim extremists behead a Buddhist monk.
A teenager is shot to death by Muslim gunmen.
Two Jihad attacks kill four, including a 10-year-old girl.  Her mother and another child were seriously injured.  Five policemen are killed in a separate bombing south of Kirkuk.
A brutal ambush on a police checkpoint by Islamic insurgents dressed as women leaves nine officers and eleven injured.
A villager is gunned down for no apparent reason by Muslim radicals.
Muslim separatists murder a civilian.
Two Buddhist rubber tappers are slain by Muslim gunmen.
Sunni insurgents machine-gun an infant to death along with twelve other Shia family members as they are returning from a minibus trip to a family cemetery.
A villager is gunned down by the Mujahideen.
Three children are killed by an al-Qaeda bomb that explodes prematurely.
Terrorists shoot three villagers to death in separate attacks (Chakras, Batapora Sopore, Kulgam)
Eleven bodies are found in Kut, five of which were beheaded.  Ten others are found outside Baghdad to days later, bound and showing signs of torture.
Car bomb on a city street kills three civilians and injures seven.
Muslim terrorists spray a car with bullets, killing the driver.
Six people are murdered in a series of coordinated attacks by Muslim terrorists.
A 61-year-old retiree is beaten to death by Muslim youth for trying to extinguish a fire that they started.
Arab militias attack a series of villages, killing at least eighteen people.
The Taliban abduct and behead two villagers.
A suicide car bomber kills nine Iraqis and injures ten.
Muslim militants kill a villager and a Buddhist policeman in coordinated attacks.
The Mujahideen gun down a civilian in an apple orchard.
Two civilians are killed in a Mujahideen bombing.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills four U.S. soldiers on security patrol along with their civilian translator.
Six bound and executed corpses are discovered on the same day that Sunni insurgents kill a policeman with a car bomb.
A car bomb explodes at a university, killing one civilian.
Lashkar-e-Toiba terrorists invade the home of a council member's brother and sister-in-law to shoot both people to death.
Two Christian 17-year-old girls are shot in the head in a brutal attack only a few days after three others were beheaded.
The Mujahideen bomb a security patrol, injuring twenty people, one of whom later succumbs to his injuries.
In two attacks, a journalist is shot to death by Islamic militants and a member of the Iraqi security forces is killed in a bombing along with his brother.
Three civilians, including a food vendor and newspaper editor, are shot to death by Muslim radicals in separate attacks.
A Buddhist businessman is murdered, and his teenage son injured, by Muslim gunmen.
A civilian is gunned down by the Mujahideen in his village.

Three coordinated and horrific suicide bombings target hotels, including Days Inn and the Grand Hyatt.  The worst damage was at the Radisson, where an al-Qaeda bomber walked into a wedding party and killed dozens, including several children.
Suicidal Sunni straps explosives to his body and kills three civilians and four policemen on patrol.  Nine other people are injured.
Seven policemen are killed in an ambush by religious extremists along a remote road.  Two others are abducted.
Two Sunni car bombs detonate outside a Shiite mosque, killing six people and injuring thirty-one.  Woman and children are among the casualties.
A former district chief and two others are killed in separate Taliban attacks.
Two suicide bombers target a packed restaurant, slaughtering over thirty people.  The vast majority of the casualties are civilian.
Seven Iraqis standing outside a recruiting center are killed in a Sunni car bombing.  Thirteen others are injured.
A teacher is shot to death by Islamic militants.
Six members of the same family are killed in an al-Qaeda landmine blast.  Six others sustain injury.
Fundamentalists fire on a group of vacationers, killing one.
The Taliban attack a police station killing one officer and injuring five others.
Drive-by shooting on the Oman embassy by Jihadis leaves two workers dead and four injured.
A congressional party activist is murdered by Muslim militants.
Three policemen are kidnapped by Taliban extremists, then shot to death in captivity.
Three Filipino soldiers are killed in an ambush by Abu Sayyaf militants and the shootouts that follow.
At least one car bomb goes off in a marketplace, killing eight shoppers, including an 8-year-old girl.
Four bodies are found, tortured and bound, along with one survivor.
A 16-year-old is among two people killed in an encounter with the Hizb-ul-Mujahideen.
A 26-year-old photojournalist is shot in the head by Abu Sayyaf militants.
Militant Muslims gun down a school teacher.
A man is murdered in front of his home by Islamic gunmen.
Islamic fundamentalists fire into the lobby of a cinema, killing four civilians.
Three civilians, including a teacher, are gunned down over the weekend by Muslim extremists.
Two South Africans are killed and three other foreigners wounded in a terrorist attack on their SUV.
Islamists walk into a grocery store and murder the husband and wife owners.  Their 10-year-old boy escapes.  Two Buddhist highway workers are shot in a separate attack.
Six civilians are killed when Jihadis bomb two passenger buses.  Over thirty others are injured.
Jamatul Mujahideen extremists hurl a bomb at a car carrying two judges, killing them both.
Islamic militants attack people in a business district, near hotels.  Four people are killed and fourteen others injured.
Two suicide bombings kill nine people and injure seven others.
A 22-year-old woman is killed inside her home by the Mujahideen.
At least three people are killed when Islamic terrorists detonate a roadside bomb in a busy commercial district.
Two policemen are kidnapped and murdered by the Religion of Peace.
Two policemen are killed by a bomb.  Two small girls are among the injured.
Seven Iraqis are killed in two separate attacks by Jihadis.
Five Afghan police are killed in a landmine attack by Taliban extremists.
al-Arifeen claims responsibility for a grenade attack on a political rally.  Seven people are killed, including a 12-year-old, and about ninety injured.
A firebomb goes off inside a fast-food restaurant, then a car bomb detonates nearby.  Three people are killed and about a dozen injured.  (Identity unclear).
A man working in a rice field is shot three times by two Islamists who stop him under the pretense of asking directions.
A man, woman and seven children, including an infant are slaughtered in their home by ten Islamic militants with assault rifles.
At least three civilians are killed by a suicide car bomber.  Another six are injured.
Two Buddhists are murdered by Muslim extremists in separate shooting attacks.
Muslim militants attack a security convoy, killing two and injuring three.
Lashkar-e-Taiba sets off a car bomb in the heart of a business district, killing at least four people and injuring over forty.
A villager is murdered in front of a tea shop by militant Muslims.
Islamic gunmen suspected in attack on a group of policemen.
Two cousins are killed inside their home by the Hizb-ul-Mujahideen.
Jihad gunmen kill a doctor inside his clinic.
Two synchronized suicide car bombs near a hotel kill at least eight people and injure about forty.
Seventy-four worshippers at two Shia mosques are slaughtered by two Sunni suicide bombers.  At least eighty others are injured amidst the carnage.
A Portuguese peacekeeper is killed in a Taliban landmine attack on his vehicle.
Machete-wielders attack and nearly decapitate a 23-year-old cosmetics salesgirl. Her 20-year-old companion's left arm is nearly hacked off as well.
One woman dies after a machete attack by militant Muslims.
A 20-year-old man is beaten with an iron bar, doused with oil and stabbed 23 times by the family of his lover in an honor killing.
A civilian is kidnapped and murdered by the Mujahideen.
The Taliban blow-up a vehicle carrying three Afghans..
Christian couple shot by radical Muslims while on their way to church.
A car bombing at a popular market leaves thirteen shoppers dead and at least fifteen others injured.
A bombing and shooting ambush by Jihad fighters leaves fifteen civilians dead and an unknown number wounded.
A suicide car bomber blows himself to Allah after plowing in a Shia funeral procession.  Thirty-six innocents are killed and at least fifty others injured.
Terrorists kill a British soldier in a roadside bombing attack.
Islamic gunmen attempt to kill three people, including a pregnant milk vendor in drive-bys.
Twelve people, including a 2-year-old boy, are injured by two bombs at a market.  One was hidden in a fruit basket.
Armed Muslim extremists rampage though a Buddhist village, killing at least three residents.
Roadside terrorist blast kills five civilians and injures fourteen others.
Four Christian women are killed when gunmen storm their home in the middle of the night.
Ten people, including eight civilians, are injured in a Mujahideen grenade attack on a city street.
A Muslim extremist shoots a man to death in a residential area, then lobs a grenade at another house, injuring a woman.
Eleven Israeli soldiers and one civilian are injured by a Hezbollah attack in northern Israel.
A village chief is shot eight times by Muslim militants as he returns home.
A man is killed in his home by Muslim militants, who also shoot his wife to keep her from getting help.
Jihadis kill eighteen innocents in a suicide bombing, including four policemen who were lured to the scene after the gunmen injured one of their own as bait.
A Muslim convert to Christianity is stabbed to death by radical Islamists after being abducted from his home.
A 4-year-old child is shot to death by Muslim extremists.
Three unarmed policemen are gunned down with Kalashnikovs while walking home after work.
A civilian who was injured in a terrorist ambush a few days earlier, succumbs to his injuries.
The Taliban behead an Indian engineer that was captured the week before.
The Mujahideen abduct a man from his home and strangle him.
A civilian is killed in a roadside terrorist bombing.
A pro-election sheik, his three sons, and a son-in-law are killed by radicals, who invade the home in the middle of the night to shoot the victims.
Three policemen are killed in a Fedayeen grenade and small arms attack on a former cinema used as a security post in a downtown area.
A Philippine solider is killed by Abu Sayyaf.
Muslim militants throw a grenade into a family's house, killing a 3-year-old girl and her sister.
An attempted ambush assassination by Jihadis leaves four innocents dead.
A bomb hidden in a car kills two people and injures two others.
Four policemen are killed by radical Sunnis while on patrol.
Women and children are amply represented among more than thirty people blown to bits by a "Holy Warrior" suicide bomber near a hospital.
Islamic militants spray a tea shop with automatic weapons, killing a patron and injuring four others.
A 42-year-old man is gunned down by Islamists on his way to work.
Terrorists target patrons at a soft drink stand with a car bomb, killing eleven and injuring seventeen.
A Swedish peacekeeper dies in a bomb attack.
A civilian is gunned down by the Mujahideen.
In a brutal attack, Jihadis ambush and kill two off-duty Iraqi soldiers and their wives.
An election worker is killed while hanging campaign posters.
A civilian is gunned down by the Taliban.
Four civilians are killed by Islamic terrorists in a car bomb attack.
A government official is killed by a sustained Taliban rocket attack on public buildings.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber drives his explosives-laden pickup truck into a crowded gas station, incinerating six innocents.
Muslim terrorists shoot a man to death in his rice paddy.
A husband is gunned down in front of his wife in an attack by Islamic extremists.
Roadside bomb kills a civilian.  In Hawija, Islamists kidnap and behead a former Army cook.
Islamic gunmen shoot two members of a pro-government news channel to death.  Four others are injured.
Seven bodies are discovered over a 24-hour period.
Government official is assassinated by Jihadis in an ambush on his vehicle.
Radical Shiites kill eight policemen in a series of attacks.
Three British citizens are murdered when a bus carrying Shia pilgrims is attacked by Sunnis.
Four men, including a legislator are shot to death in a brutal Jihadi assassination.
Jamiat-ul-Mujahideen terrorists stop a car carrying a local official then execute him and his cousin.
Jihadis enter a house and murder a man and his son.
A man is shot off the back of his motorcycle by Muslim radicals.
Two Christians are gunned down by Muslim militants as they are hanging campaign posters.
Jamaatul Mujahideen suicide bomber at a law library kills at least five others and injures over fifty.
A suicide bombing at a courthouse checkpoint kills at least two people.
A 33-year-old Buddhist is gunned down by Islamic militants.
Muslims kill a 40-year-old Buddhist man as he is on his way to tend cattle.
Jihad gunmen open up on a minibus with assault weapons, killing nine farm workers as they are boarding.
Two boys are killed by a landmine planted by Islamic militants.
A Shiite leader is killed in a sectarian drive-by attack.
The bodies of four men, bound and executed, are found.  In Basra, radicals kill an Iraqi translator.
Two innocent victims of a bomb-making cell are a teenage student and a 5-year-old boy.
An Islamist straps a bomb to his leg then detonates it in a DA's office, killing two other people.
Two Buddhist villagers are shot at by Muslim militants, one of whom succumbs to injury.
A village headsman is gunned down by Islamic radicals.
Ten U.S. Marines guarding a hospital are senselessly killed by Islamic bombers
The Mujahideen enter the house of a widow and shoot her to death.
Islamic militants shoot a teacher to death by the side of the road.
A man is kidnapped and murdered by the Mujahideen.
A Sunni group, Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, takes credit for killing a Shia cleric in front of his home.
A district chief is killed in a Taliban roadside bombing along with two other Afghans.
A Taliban ambush on a police vehicle leaves one officer dead.
Iraqi soldiers are ambushed by terrorists while in transport.  Nineteen are killed.
Christian pastor killed following threats.
Two civilians are killed by a bomb planted under a car on a city street.  Elsewhere in the city, a Shiite cleric is gunned down.
al-Qaeda backed militants kill a Pakistani soldier.
A civilian is killed by a suicide bomber.  Two others are injured.
A civilian is killed in a Mujahideen attack.
A Sunni cleric is killed in a sectarian attack while buying food at a store.
The bodies of eleven civilians are found, bound and executed.
Two civilians are among three dead in a drive-by Taliban shooting.
Five Israelis are murdered at the entrance to a shopping mall by a bomber from the militant group, 'Islamic Jihad'.
Religious extremists kill a school janitor walking home from work.
A man is murdered in front of his family by Islamic terrorists.
A cleric is gunned down by Islamists on a motorcycle.
Two al-Qaeda suicide bombers walk into separate classrooms at a police academy and slaughter more than forty students.  Over seventy others are injured.
Nine bodies of civilians are found, bound and executed.
Jihadis gun down three employees of an Iraqi oil company as they are driving home.
Two Pakistani soldiers are kidnapped and beheaded by Islamic fundamentalists.
The Taliban kill seven tribesmen in their homes, later mutilating and hanging the bodies from utility poles.
Three people at a cafe are murdered by a Fedayeen suicide bomber.  Twenty other patrons are injured.
Three hospital guards are gunned down on the job by terrorists.
Nine Russians manning a checkpoint are injured when Jihad gunmen open fire.
The Islamic Army of Iraq claims to have executed an unarmed American civilian abducted earlier.
Twelve people are killed when a planted bomb rips through a hotel restaurant.  Forty others are injured.
A 'Holy Warrior' blows apart more than thirty passengers on a packed bus, including women and children, as they are prepared to travel home for the weekend.
A Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh suicide bomber kills six people working in a Communist Party office.
A security guard at a civilian residence is shot and killed at point blank range by a Muslim terrorist.
Taliban extremists attack a police patrol, killing one officer.
Bombing at a traffic crossing kills one person and leaves ten others injured.
A 20-year-old Israeli soldier is fatally stabbed in the neck by an al-Aqsa terrorist at a point of entry.
Two civilians are among four people reported killed by the Taliban.
A Buddhist husband and wife are brutally murdered by radical Muslims.
The Taliban attack a remote checkpoint, killing a policeman and injuring two others.
Two men are killed by Islamic insurgents.  The body of a kidnapped intelligence officer is found in Balad.
An Egyptian man working to build a medical clinic is kidnapped and murdered by Islamic insurgents.
The Taliban kill two more people, decapitating them and hanging their bodies upside down from pylons.
Terrorists kill two civilians with a roadside bomb.
Two campaign workers are shot while hanging posters.
Seven policemen are killed when religious extremists stage an assault on their compound.
Sunni gunmen attack a car carrying off-duty Iraqi soldiers, killing two.
A shop owner is killed in his place of business by Muslim terrorists.
Three Jihad attacks kill six people and the bodies of four abductees are discovered.
Christian reporter is assassinated by a car bombing that kills three other people.  Thirty innocents are injured in the blast.
A hotel owner is killed in a sectarian attack.
The Mujahideen gun down a civilian near his home.
Three members of a family, including a child, are killed when al-Qaeda-backed militants attack their home with a dozen rockets.
Two Filipino soldiers are killed in a gunfight with Abu Sayyaf militants.
An election candidate is gunned down by Jihadis while waiting for gas at a station.
Two civilians are kidnapped and killed by religious extremists.
A student who refused to join the Mujahideen is kidnapped and shot to death.
A pro-government cleric is assassinated by the Taliban as he is riding to work.
The Taliban drag a teacher out of his classroom and kill him for teaching girls.  He had ignored previous warnings.
A polling station guard is killed when militants toss a grenade from a motorcycle.
A man is murdered by Islamists as he is walking home from evening exercises.
Islamists murder a civilian.
The Mujahideen kills two villagers near their home.
Two civilians die in separate incidents.  One is kidnapped and murdered, the other is killed with a grenade.
Four children playing soccer are among five killed by Islamic insurgents mortaring a schoolyard.  Two other children are injured.
A woman is shot to death by Islamic militants.
The Mujahideen open fire on a group of civilians, killing one and injuring another.
al-Aqsa fires on a passenger car carrying Israeli civilians, killing a 35-year-old man.
Two passersby are killed by a Fedayeen suicide car bomber.  Two others are injured.
A barbershop attack by fundamentalists leaves three dead and one injured.
Three policemen are killed when religious extremists storm a checkpoint.
The Taliban murder an 18-year-old student and a school guard with automatic weapons.
Three attacks, including a Fedayeen bombing, leave four innocents dead and thirteen injured.  The bodies of two people are recovered elsewhere.
A terrorist's roadside bomb kills two police officers and injures two.
Arab militias kill at least twenty villagers, including an elderly man, three women and two children.
Three bodyguards of a politician are killed in a Jihad ambush on their car.
A suicidal religious extremist kills two people outside a children's hospital with a bomb.
The Taliban abduct and behead a man, then hang his body from a pole while throwing the head into a cemetery.
Three Afghan soldiers are killed in an ambush by religious extremists.
Muslims behead a Buddhist civilian.
A farmer is shot to death by Islamic terrorists.
Muslim radicals shoot a 55-year-old Buddhist to death as he is working in his orchard.
A 42-year-old man is gunned down by Islamists while walking home from work.
A man is abducted and beheaded by the local Taliban.
Religious fundamentalists kill three men at a barbershop.
Sunni gunmen rake a passenger bus with machine-guns, killing at least four civilians.
Jihadis murder four policemen at a checkpoint with a barrage of automatic weapons fire.  Six others are injured.
Al-Mansooran claims responsibility for a grenade attack that kills one person.  Elsewhere (Guloora Handwara) a civilian is shot to death.
Two more bullet-ridden victims of Islamic seminary students calling themselves the Taliban are found in a stream.
Two foreign civilians are killed in an IED terror attack.
Eight Iraqi policemen are massacred when Jihadis open up on their checkpoint with rockets and automatic weapons.
Islamists car-bomb a tea shop, injuring at least seven people.
A suicidal Sunni on a bicycle rides it up to a Shia mosque and detonates, killing ten innocents.
The lives of nine people are cut short by Mujahideen terrorists in three attacks over 24 hours.
Radicals murder a university professor out for a morning walk.
A Buddhist civilian is shot to death by Muslim radicals.
The Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat blows up a coast guard boat, killing three innocents.
Seven civilians are gunned down by Jihadis in three separate attacks, while the bodies of seven others are found bound and executed.
A 46-year-old school guard is cut down in a hail of automatic weapons fire from Muslim extremists.
Islamists kill the nephew of a pro-government leader at a market.
Two civilians are killed by a terrorist car bombing.
A man is killed and a woman seriously injured by Islamic gunmen while riding a motorcycle.
Two members of the Buddhist minority are shot to death by Muslim militants on a road.
The body of a civilian that had been abducted by Islamists is recovered.
Five separate bombings kill eight civilians as three bodies are found bound and executed.
Five Iraqi soldiers are killed in a coordinated terror attack.
al-Qaeda slaughters five policemen at a checkpoint with rockets and mortars from point-blank range.
Two people are gunned down by Jihadis in their car.
Suspected Arab militias attack a village, killing twenty people.
An innocent villager is murdered by Islamists.
A Buddhist villager is shot off the back of his motorcycle by Muslim gunmen.
Five Saudi policemen are killed in two drive-by shooting attacks by an Islamic fundamentalists.
Four residents are killed in their homes by terrorists.
Islamic insurgents attack a poultry farm, killing four Iraqi workers.
Two girls and their parents are stabbed to death by Allah's holy warriors.
Two people, including a civilian, are killed when the Taliban ambush a military convoy.
Lashkar-e-Taiba suspected in a campus attack on a university professor and four others.
A village headsman is gunned down by Islamists.
A civilian is shot and killed by Muslim gunmen.
A civilian shot and killed by Muslim terrorists in his home while eating dinner.
Four Iraqi policemen are killed by a Fedayeen suicide bomber.
A suicide bomber exits a taxi and detonates an explosives belt, killing an Israeli and four other Palestinians, including the taxi driver.  Islamic Jihad takes credit.
Eleven members of a Shiite family are massacred by six Sunnis, who invade their home and slit the throats of all, including children.
al-Qaeda militants open fire on a restaurant, killing a Pakistani soldier.
A local tribal leader is abducted by militant Muslims, who then slash his throat.
The Taliban ambush a vehicle on a remote road, killing a passenger.
Terrorists use mortars to kill six civilians near a coffee shop.
Religious extremists use a bomb to kill four policemen and injure seven.
Two security force members are gunned down in their car.
A father slits the throats of his three daughters after learning that at least one was 'dishonored' by adultery.
The Mujahideen kill a police officer in a shooting ambush on a city street.
Islamic extremists kill nine people in a drive-by shooting, because the victims were drinking alcohol in public.
Muslim extremists shoot a retired teacher to death as he is jogging along a road with his brother.
Two civilians and a child are among five killed when Islamic militants attack a security patrol.
Islamic fundamentalists kill a 23-year-old Christian and his Muslim girlfriend because their relationship was against Sharia.
The Mujahideen invade a home and open fire on the residents, killing the father and injuring another family member.
Eight Christians are killed when Islamists bomb a market selling pork at a time when it is packed with shoppers.  The bomb was packed with nails.
Five civilians die in a bombing attack on their vehicle.
Two people are killed in a bomb blast staged by Islamic militants. Three others are injured.
An 18-year-old Hindu is kidnapped by militant Muslims and tortured to death.
Two Russian guards are killed by Jihadi snipers.
Islamic militants attack four Thai soldiers, capturing and beheading one of them.
Three more civilians are killed by Muslim radicals in a drive-by shooting.
Two children, ages 7 and 10, are killed by Jihadi gunmen in an attack that also injures their parents.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber rams his car into a bus carrying police recruits, killing seven and injuring thirteen.
A militant Muslim assassinates a village headsman outside his home with an automatic rifle.
A civilian is abducted from his job site and hanged by the Mujahideen.
Two Taliban members shoot a humanitarian aid worker in the back of the head as he is kneeling in prayer.
A 51-year-old man is gunned down by Islamic radicals as he is eating breakfast in a tea shop.
The Taliban kill the headmaster of a school by cutting off his head in front of his wife and eight children.
Two civilians are killed by a roadside terror bombing.
Three civilians are killed and thirteen others injured by a terrorist car bombing on a city street.
Nearly forty people are blown to bits by a Fedayeen suicide bomber at a Shiite funeral for a child.  At least forty more suffer various injury and lost limbs.
At least eight civilians are killed and twelve injured when radical Sunnis detonate a bomb near a market.
An oil company employee and his son are shot to death in a Jihad attack.  Two other bodies found executed in Mahawil.
One Russian is killed by Chechen Mujahideen who infiltrated the border.

Four bombs, two of them suicide attacks in Baghdad, leave four people dead in the capital and Najaf.  Four policemen are also killed by Jihad gunmen in Baqubah and seven U.S. soldiers are killed in two terror attacks.
Two children are among ten people murdered by an Islamic suicide bomber in a crowded area of the capital.  Fifty others are injured.
Eighty people waiting in line to apply for jobs at a recruiting station are blown to bits by a religious fanatic.  Another seventy are injured.
A Sunni suicide bomber targets a Shia shrine, killing more than sixty innocent souls and injuring seventy more.  Women and children are amply represented among the victims.
Two Yemeni troops are killed in an ambush by radical Islamists.
Four civilians are killed, and two injured, in a mortar attack by armed fundamentalists.
An American journalist is taken hostage, and her Iraqi translator murdered.
Four civilian employees of a state water company are killed by the Salafist Group for Preaching and Combat.
A terrorist bombing by the Taliban leaves one civilian dead and another person injured.
Two policemen are murdered by Islamic fundamentalists.  Separately, a bomb at a tea shop injures three people.
A doctor is gunned down by Jihadis.  Elsewhere, a suicide bomber injures nine people.
Eight soldiers are massacred by religious militants at a border checkpoint.
A grocery store is shot up by Muslim radicals.  Two people in their 20's are killed and four others injured.
Islamic militants kill a pig farmer and also fire on a family of foreigners, injuring three, including a baby.
A 6-year-old boy is killed by a bomb that also injures an 8-year-old.
A family is massacred by the Taliban.  The dead include a young girl.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills two Iraqis and injures five others outside a mosque.
The burnt body of a 74-year-old Buddhist is found after he is murdered by Islamic radicals, who beat the elderly man severely before slashing his throat.
Two Fedayeen suicide bomber maximize their killing power and send themselves and dozens of others to Allah at a government building.
Muslim radicals shoot a 60-year-old Buddhist three times in the neck after vowing to 'keep killing innocents'.
Ansar al-Sunna terrorists gun down a judge.
The Mujahideen abduct a man from his home and shoot him to death.
al-Qaeda backed militants kill seven Pakistani soldiers in a rocket attack.
A teenage girl is killed when militants hurl a grenade into her home on Eid day.  Two other relatives are injured.
The Moro Islamic Front is suspected in the assassination of a local sultan.
Two policemen are killed by a car bomb.  Another dead officer is found in Iskandariya, blindfolded and with hands tied behind his back.
A rocket attack leaves one man dead and three children injured.
Sunni gunmen assassinate a Shiite cleric.  Elsewhere, a bomb kills two policemen.
The Taliban assassinate a political figure outside his home.
Religious fundamentalists bomb a sporting event and a music shop, injuring twenty-two.
al-Qaeda backed militants fire a rocket into a home, killing a man and injuring his two children.
Two men are killed in a landmine blast.
Five separate Jihad attacks and kidnappings leave at least six dead around the country.
At least three people are killed, including two civilians, when a suicide bomber rams a Canadian convoy.
Islamists butcher two 20-year-old men in a gruesome attack.
A contractor is abducted and killed by the Mujahideen.
Five people are killed and ten others injured by a "Holy Warrior" suicide bomber.
A Fedayeen bomber plows an explosives-laden motorbike into a crowd of people in a downtown area, killing at least twenty-two.
Islamic radicals gun down two political activists in separate attacks.
A physics professor is gunned down in a brutal attack.
A Jihad car bombing kills six, including a child, and injures eighteen.
A policeman is killed by Jihadis.
Four Russians and one Chechen are blown apart in a landmine attack by Muslim rebels.
Radical Sunni gunmen kill two Kurdish election officials in separate attacks.
Sunni radicals infiltrate an office building and murder three men.
Jihadis ambush a private convoy, blasting and shooting twelve guards and bystanders to death and kidnapping two African engineers.
Four people are killed in a terror bombing attack on a police vehicle.
The body of a civilian is recovered ten days after being abducted by the Mujahideen.
Two American civilians are killed in a roadside terrorist bombing.
Muslims go on a rampage against Christians, angered by the construction of a church.  Two, including a 13-year-old boy, are killed.
Twelve civilians are machine-gunned to death by radical Sunnis after their cars were stopped at a fake roadblock.
A Palestinian suicide bomber injures two dozen Israelis in an attack on a fast-food stall at a bus station.
Two religious extremists hit a coffee shop in a downtown area with suicide bombs, dismembering themselves and twenty-three innocents while causing egregious injury to two dozen others.
A civilian is shot to death by the Mujahideen at his village.
A homosexual is shot to death by Islamic extremists.
Suspected Islamists invade the home of a civilian, killing him and injuring his wife and son.
A 63-year-old farmer is killed when a bomb planted at the base of a cell tower explodes.
Four civilians are killed in a roadside bomb and two other people are gunned down by Muslim radicals in separate Karbala attacks.
The bodies of seven civilians are found bound and executed where two others were found days earlier.
Two civilians are killed by Islamic terrorists in a small village.
Indonesian soldiers kill four unarmed Papua teenagers (ages 13 to 15) in an unprovoked attack as they are walking to school.  A fifth boy is severely beaten.
Four civilians die when militants hit a food store with a rocket.
Three butchers standing on a corner are mowed down in a drive-by shooting by radical Muslims.
Six people, including a child, are killed in four separate Jihad attacks across the country.
Seven people are injured in a Mujahideen grenade attack.
A policeman is killed in a Taliban ambush.
A suicide car bombing, two brutal kidnappings (including a man and his son) and a roadside terror attack leave twelve people dead across the country.
Four children (ages 6 to 11) and a man are killed when Islamic insurgents deliberately fire a rocket into a home.
The bodies of twenty-three police recruits are found bound and executed, days after they were forced off a bus at gunpoint by Sunni terrorists.
A Fedayeen suicide car bomber kills two civilians.  Another civilian is killed, and over a dozen wounded in two other car bombings.
The bodies of eight police recruits are found.  Two separate Jihad attacks claim three more lives elsewhere.
At least eight people are killed by two bombs in an Iranian city.  Some forty-six are injured in the sectarian attack.
Jama'atul Mujahideen terrorists kill a Hindu woman and her daughter at a memorial service for her dead father by throwing two bombs at them.  Nine others were injured.
Taliban militants attack a remote police post with rockets, killing two and injuring two.
Uzbeki Islamic Movement terrorists kill a prison warden to free a comrade.
Jihadis kill at least ten people in five separate attacks, along with two bodies found bound and blindfolded a day earlier.
Terrorists attempt an assassination, killing three bodyguards instead.
Religious extremists kill two policemen with a roadside bomb.
A policeman is killed in a Mujahideen mine attack.
Five separate Jihad attacks leave seven people dead and nine others injured.
Six bodies are found bound, blindfolded and executed in a garbage dump.
Two army personnel are killed by Lashkar-e-Toiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists, who infiltrated the border.
Muslims shoot a Christian couple to death as they are riding a motorcycle on their way home.
Radical Sunnis plant a bomb outside a shop in a Shia town, blowing at least ten people into disparate parts.
Muslim terrorists shoot a 41-year-old government official to death in his home.
A 38-year-old schoolteacher is killed by Muslim radicals while walking home from work.
Islamic militants open fire on a railway station, killing two guards.
A policeman is abducted and murdered by the Mujahideen.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber blows himself to Allah, taking several innocents along with him.
Muslims target Christian churches with six car bombs, killing at least three people and injuring eleven.
Two Pakistani soldiers are killed by an al-Qaeda landmine.
A baker is killed by Islamic radicals in his shop.
Jihadis kill the wife and two sons of a religious cleric in their home.
The bodies of fourteen young people are found blindfolded, bound and executed at two separate sites.
A Fedayeen bomber kills eight men waiting for work next to a crowded intersection.  At least fifty others are in various states of physical agony from the blast.
A man and his son are gunned down on their way home by Islamists.
Sunni insurgents kill at least eight people in four separate terror attacks around the country.
Muslims stab a 63-year-old Buddhist man to death as he is working his rubber plantation.
Muslim separatists are suspected to be behind three bombings at gambling establishments that kill a young man and woman.
Islamists kill a village chief's driver and deputy with a shrapnel bomb hidden under their vehicle.
The bodies of fourteen men, blindfolded and tortured, are discovered.  Sectarian violence also claims five other lives in five additional attacks around the country.
The Taliban send a Fedayeen suicide bomber to kill three Afghan soldiers and two civilians at a checkpoint.
A 42-year-old wood trader is gunned down by Muslim terrorists.
A Buddhist policeman is killed when Islamic radicals attempt to kill a group of teachers under escort in a motorcade with a bomb hidden in a fire extinguisher.
Sixteen people are killed in two Islamic terror bombings.  One shrapnel bomb detonated at a gas station and the other at a market.
A university professor is murdered after receiving death threats from Islamic fundamentalists.
Islamists massacre a family of Christians after confirming their religious identity.  The victims included an infant and other young children.
Three policemen are killed and thirteen injured in a series of Taliban ambushes.
A Buddhist teacher is gunned down by Muslim militants and four others are wounded in a separate attack on teachers.
In a heinous attack, Sunni extremists kill an Iraqi translator.
Hizb-ul-Mujahideen  behead a young man.
Thirty-three people are injured by a mobile-phone bombing at a cafe, including a teenager who succumbs to injuries two days later.
al-Qaeda militants detonate a bomb under a truck, killing three Pakistanis.
Two people are killed in a train crash resulting from an act of sabotage by suspected Islamists.
Two overnight attacks by religious extremists leave at least five people dead, including a district chief.
Six policemen are killed when Islamic fundamentalists set off a landmine under their vehicle.
A woman and her child are killed in a Taliban remote-control bomb attack on a city street.
A Sunni radical fires into a crowd of Shiites marching in a procession, killing three.
A dozen people are blown to bits when Taliban terrorists bomb a passenger bus.
A Palestinian stabs an Israeli woman to death as she is riding a bus.  Four others were stabbed as well.
Six people are killed in four separate attacks by Jihadis, including two men who were tortured to death.
Two people are killed, and seven wounded by a car bomb along a city street.
A Catholic priest is murdered by an assailant who shouts 'Allah Akbar!' after he fires the gun.
A civilian is murdered by the Mujahideen.
Muslims kill a 71-year-old Buddhist as he is on his way home with his 16-year-old granddaughter.
Three villagers are shot to death by Muslim militants in a heinous attack on a market.
The body of an Iraqi contractor is found, and three other people are killed in two separate Jihad attacks.
Muslim terrorists abduct a civilian from his home and murder him in captivity.
Muslim terrorists gun down a policeman.
Two engineers working on road construction are killed by religious extremists in a bomb attack, along with two Afghans.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber drives an explosives-laden motorbike into a crowd near a police post, killing at least thirteen.
Seven people are killed in at least three separate attacks around the country by Jihad terrorists.
Seven civilians are among eight people blown to bits by two terrorist bombings along a crowded roadside.
A Buddhist is shot in the head at close range by Muslims while on his way home.
Local Islamists abduct and behead a man, leaving the body with a note attached.
Three civilians are among five people killed when a Fedayeen suicide bomber rams a checkpoint with a car.
Some 31 Shiites are blown to bits while celebrating a religious holiday by a suicidal Sunni extremist.  The dead include women and children.
Jihadi gunmen kill four people in three separate attacks, including two who were murdered in captivity.
At least five people die in religious violence after Sunnis accuse Shias of destroying a sacred flag.
A woman is among two people killed in an ambush by Muslim terrorists.
Abu Sayyaf terrorists kill a police chief in front of his family.
Eight Afghan soldiers are killed by two Taliban landmines, the second designed to kill those trying to help the first.
Four people are killed in three separate Jihad attacks, including a woman inside her home.
A grisly scene as nine people are killed at a Shiite mosque by a car bomb detonated by radical Sunnis.  Nearly forty others were injured.
A woman is among four people killed when radicals open fire on a train in a sectarian attack.
A civilian is abducted and hanged to death by the Mujahideen.
Three members of a family, including two women, are blown apart in a roadside bomb blast.
Militant Muslims shoot a policeman in the head in front of a bakery.  The same group beheaded another man in a separate attack in the same area.
A brutal shooting attack in which a Fedayeen holds a gun to a woman's head before killing her.
Radical Sunnis sneak up and shoot two policemen in the head as they are sitting in their car.
Islamic militants ambush a troop carrier with automatic weapons, killing one Russian soldier.
Muslim radicals kill a civilian outside his home.
Three more people, including a 9-year-old boy, are killed in sectarian violence.
A doctor and a sports director are among seven people gunned down by Jihadis in four separate attacks around the country.
The bodies of six people, who were bound and tortured, are found at three separate sites.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber kills four people at a checkpoint.
A child is among two killed by a roadside terror bombing.
Two Afghan soldiers are killed in a Taliban ambush.  Another six are captured and executed in captivity.
A young Jewish man is kidnapped by a Muslim gang and tortured for three weeks before expiring of his wounds.
Sunnis slaughter a family of four Shias sitting in their car, in an automatic weapons attack.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber standing outside a bank blows himself to Allah, taking at least seven innocent bystanders with him.  Children are among the victims.
Seven policemen are gunned down at a road construction guard post by the Afghan Taliban.
A doctor is gunned down outside his clinic.
An 8-year-old boy is shot in the face by an Islamic activist protesting cartoons.
A horrible Valentine's day massacre as Sunnis round up a family of Shiites and then machine-gun them to death, including a 5-year-old boy.  Only one other child escaped death.
Six civilians are injured when a Muslim militant tosses a grenade into the street.  One succumbs to injuries two days later.
Gunmen kill an Iraqi contractor and, in a separate attack in Baghdad, a man and his son.
Three Chinese engineers and their Pakistani driver are shot to death in their car by Muslim terrorists.
Two deadly bombing attacks, including one at a university leave six Iraqis dead, as five more bodies are found dumped elsewhere.
Four children, ages 10 to 14, are blown up by Islamic fundamentalists targeting a liquor store as they are walking to school.  Two brothers and their sister were among the four.
A Hindu sailor is beaten to death by Iranian crewmates, angered over Muhammad cartoons.
An attack by religious fundamentalists kills one policeman and leaves four others injured.
The Mujahideen force their way into a home, then shoot a man to death and injure his brother.
Muslim militants murder a policeman assigned to guard teachers from terror attacks.
Two car bombs, one near a crowded market, kill seven civilians and injure over a dozen more.  Elsewhere, four bodies are found bound and blindfolded.
Two Afghani intelligence agents are kidnapped and beheaded by religious extremists.
Jihadis kill a dozen people in four separate attacks, which included an 18-month-old girl and the kidnapping of a bank manager and his son after slaughtering five bodyguards.
A security guard at an irrigation plant is murdered by Islamic militants.
Islamists shoot a Buddhist villager, then detonate a bomb that injures thirteen people investigating the scene.
The Mujahideen gun down a policeman in a brutal attack that also injures a young girl.
Angry Muslim mobs burn churches and beat Christians to death.  At least sixteen people are killed in the violence.
Two Jihad bombings kill two people and injure five.
Five people are killed in three separate roadside terror attacks as two more kidnap victims are discovered.
Abu Sayyaf bombs a karaoke bar, killing a janitor and injuring about two dozen others.  Another civilian later dies of injuries.
A late night attack by the Taliban on a police post leaves three officers dead.
Car bombing on a city street followed by a suicide bomber kills two people.
Three policemen are killed by radical Sunnis in a roadside bombing.
Muslim mobs target Nigerian Christians in a protest against Danish cartoons.  More churches are burned and seven more are killed.
A civilian is gunned down in broad daylight by the Mujahideen.
Two people, at least one of whom was Buddhist, are shot to death by Muslim radicals in separate attacks.
Islamists murder a civilian.
Muslim radicals kill ten people in five deadly attacks around the country.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber massacres a dozen innocent Shias on a passenger bus.  Survivors suffered horrible burns.
A Jihadi eats his breakfast at a packed diner, then places a bomb under the counter before walking out.  Five people killed.  Two dozen injured.
Uzbeki Islamists kill a local tribesman in a terror attack.
Militant Muslims shoot a civilian to death on a highway.
An additional thirty bodies are counted from the Muslim rioting against Christians over the weekend.
Suspected Islamists kill a Russian woman with a grenade.
Muslims mobs take out their rage on Christians in yet a third Nigerian state, killing at least twenty-five and injuring over one-hundred in a two-day spree.
Islamists shoot two brothers execution-style.
Jihadis set off a car bomb at a crowded market, killing at least twenty-two innocents and injuring dozens more.
A roadside bomb destroys a pick-up truck carrying workers to a job site.  Two similar attacks elsewhere take four more lives.
Thai Islamists gun down a border patrolman as he is riding a motorcycle.
A local Jewish leader and father of four is beaten to death.
Three Sunni clerics are assassinated as Shias go on a mosque-burning  rampage.  Three guards are also killed.
Two brothers are among six people gunned down in two separate attacks by radical Sunnis.
Two children and a woman are killed when terrorists set off a bomb near a primary school.
Religious extremists set off a bicycle bomb, killing one civilian and injuring twelve.
al-Qaeda supported militants kill a village chief and injure three of his family members.
The Mujahideen murder a woman outside her village.
A man shoots his two sisters to death on suspicion that they were having love affairs.
Reprisal from the destruction of a Shiite mosque leaves at least fifty Sunnis dead in random attacks around the capital.
A suicide bomber slaughters sixteen people at a market and injures two dozen others.  Five people are killed in a second bombing
Radical Shias raid a prison and haul away thirteen Sunni prisoners.  At least eleven are executed.  Separate attacks leaves more casualties.
In a horrific crime, 47 demonstrators for peace, ages 20 to 50, are forced from their cars at gunpoint and then machine-gunned to death by Sunni Jihadis.
A reporter for the al-Arabiya network is kidnapped, stripped naked, tortured and then brutally murdered by men shouting 'Allah Akbar'.
Islamic terrorists murder a university student.
Two oil refinery guards are killed defending the plant against suicide bombers.
Sunni gunmen raid a house in the middle of the night and kill two women and a man.  Two young children are injured in the attack.
Taliban fundamentalists ambush and kill four Afghan soldiers.
At least four Christians are clubbed to death by a Muslim mob, and five churches burned.
Machete-wielding Muslims hack nine Christians apart and set fire to four churches.
Only weeks after the Hizb-ul-Mujahideen beheaded her fianc, the same group breaks into a young woman's house and shoots her to death.
In a horrible attack, thirteen members of a Shia family (representing three generations) are slaughtered by Sunni gunmen as they are fleeing the violence.
Eight people are blown apart by a Sunni car bomb at a crowded market.  At least thirty others are injured.
Twenty-six bodies are found in six locations in the city.  Some showed signs of torture.
Radicals attack a funeral procession for a journalist, killing at least three people.
A Thai soldier is killed after being ambushed by Islamic radicals.
A woman is killed when a militant throws a hand grenade trough the window of her house.
Muslim radicals shoot mortars into residential neighborhoods, killing fifteen Sunnis and three Shias.  Three other bodies are found elsewhere.
Jihadis open fire on a group of teenagers playing soccer, killing two boys and injuring five.
A Muslim terrorist detonates a bomb in a passenger bus at a station, killing at least five people.
A local doctor is killed by Islamists while walking home from work.
Angry Muslims pull a pediatrician from his office and execute him.
Taliban-led prison uprising leaves six inmates dead and about forty injured.
Two policemen are killed by al-Qaeda militants.
The Mujahideen gun down a civilian on the street.
Two villagers are gunned down by Islamic terrorists in separate attacks.
Four people are killed in a mortar attack and three more die in a roadside bombing near Kirkuk.  Four bound bodies are found elsewhere.
Gunmen kill the owner of a glaze shop and an employee.
Two Filipino oil workers are killed when al-Qaeda militants open fire on Saudi security forces.
Islamic terrorists kill an animal worker.
A bomb hidden in a food market injures eight.
Four separate Jihad bombings leave at least eighteen dead and over forty injured.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber joins a line of people waiting for kerosene, then detonates his explosives, killing two dozen innocents and injuring many more.
Sunnis roundup and execute nine Shias, leaving their bodies at a dump site.
Religious extremists bomb a Shiite mosque, slaughtering twenty-three innocents and leaving dozens more in various states of agony.
Radicals kill two family members attending a Shiite funeral.
Terrorists use mortar rounds to kill three members of the same family.
Jihadis ambush a police patrol, killing four officers.
Islamic militants murder a rubber wood trader.
A postman is shot to death by Islamists.
Two policemen are murdered by Islamic militants while on street patrol.
Two Muslims gun down a Jew outside a gas station.  The victim was a father of two.
Radical Muslims set off two car bombs in civilian areas.  At least twenty-five people are burned to death or torn apart by shrapnel.
The Mujahideen abduct a teenage boy and then behead him in captivity.
The local Taliban kill a civilian and leave his body in the open.
Two security personnel are gunned down by the Mujahideen.
A civilian is murdered by the Mujahideen.
A Sunni cleric is assassinated, and a man and woman are found dead from a separate Shiite attack.
In a senseless act of violence, gunmen spray a car with machine-gun fire after it left a police academy.
Jihadis attack a police checkpoint, killing six officers.
Islamic militants bomb a market, slaughtering eight innocents including a child.
Five people are killed when Muslim radicals bomb a passenger bus.  Five additional bodies are found elsewhere.
A suicide bomber kills four people, including two Americans, outside a hotel.
Muslim rioters kill two Hindus and injure a dozen more.
Abu Sayyaf suspected in the shooting assassination of a city mayor.
Sunnis attack Shiite laborers at two brick factories, executing twenty-five people with a shot to the forehead.  Among the dead was at least one woman and three children, including a 6-year-old girl.
Calling it the will of Allah, an Iranian immigrant plows his SUV into a crowd of students as 'retribution' for foreign policy overseas.
al-Qaeda backed militants attack a security patrol, killing two Pakistani troops.
Six Taliban terrorists drag a UN engineer from his car and shoot him to death.
One person is killed by a Taliban landmine.
Religious extremists kill four Afghan security agents and an electrician with a remote-controlled bomb.
Two civilians die from injuries received in a car bombing on a city street.
A Muslim militant throws a grenade at children playing in the street, killing two young girls.
Seven people are killed when Jihadis lob a mortar round into a crowded market.
Taliban terrorists assassinate a government official with machine-gun fire into his car from motorcycles.
A 21-year-old man is gunned down in an Islamist attack against him and his teenage sister.
Two Shias are killed inside their mosque by Sunni gunmen.
Fundamentalists kill a young girl with a bombing of a store that sold musical paraphernalia.
A civilian is shot to death by the Mujahideen outside his home.
Shia gunmen storm a Sunni mosque, killing three people.
Two policemen die when a Jaish-e-Mohammad radical lobs a grenade at their picket.
A man is gunned down by the Mujahideen at a bus stop.
Twenty-four civilians and two police are injured when a Jaish-e-Mohammad militant tosses a grenade into the road.
Religious fundamentalists murder two barbers who were on their way to work.
Islamic militants kidnap and behead a school teacher.
Three Jihad car bombs kill five and injure sixteen.
Two girls under the age of 4 are among the six deaths when Sunni radicals detonate a car bomb at a busy market.  Three other people are killed is separate shooting attacks.
Two civilians are gunned down by Islamic separatists.
Radical Muslims storm a Buddhist village and shoot an elderly couple and their neighbor to death, then set fire to their homes.
Militants fire a rocket into a house, killing a young woman and injuring two children.
Muslim terrorists (Lashkar-e-Toiba) use a trio of bombs against Hindu civilians at a religious prayer offering.  At least twenty-three innocents are massacred and several dozen injured.
Sunni gunmen kill three Shias at a political office.  A separate car bombing kills one civilian.
Three security force members are killed outside an oil refinery in an ambush by Sunni insurgents.
Islamists behead a 41-year-old plantation worker.
Fundamentalists attack a vehicle, killing one of the occupants.
A woman and her 12-year-old son are killed by the Mujahideen in a bomb explosion.
A woman who suffered injuries when Muslims attacked her on 11/21 finally succumbs.  Elsewhere, the Mujahideen kidnaps a 17-year-old and chops off his fingers.
al-Qaeda militants shoot a civilian to death and pin a warning note to his body.
Islamic terrorists kill four civilians with a remote-controlled bomb.
Two young boys selling gas are among four people killed in two bombings by Jihadis.
The bodies of eighteen men are found bound and strangled on a minibus.  Five other bodies are found elsewhere.
An SPO is kidnapped by Islamic militants and killed in captivity.
A villager is brutally gunned down by the Mujahideen.
Armed fundamentalists kill a freed prisoner by spraying his home with automatic weapons fire.
A policemen and his daughter are killed when sectarian radicals toss a bomb into their home.
Terrorists set off a bomb in front of a hospital and another in a street to kill eight civilians and injure fifteen.
Islamists gun down a Buddhist outside his home.
A Buddhist man is found murdered with a note on his body from Islamists acknowledging that they are killing the innocent.
al-Qaeda backed militants attack a Pakistani checkpoint, killing two soldiers.
The son of a pro-government leader is murdered by the local Taliban.
Religious fundamentalists kill the host of an educational and cultural TV show while on his way to interview poets.
A 6-year-old is burned to death when two Muslims burn down her family's house in an attempted honor killing.
Angry Muslims shoot into the house of an Anglican bishop, killing one person and injuring another.
Radicals plant a bomb under the car of a government official, killing him and badly injuring his driver.
An apparent Fedayeen suicide bombing leaves two other people dead.
Eleven people are killed by a suicide truck bomber at an intersection.
Six bodies are found bound and executed.
Two car bombings leave three civilians dead.
A civilian is killed by gunmen, and another ten injured.  Jihadis also kidnap four women.
Twenty-eight people traveling to a wedding party are blown to bits by a landmine suspected to have been planted by the Taliban.
Islamic fundamentalists murder a man, then circulate pamphlets as a warning to others.
The Islamic government targets six villages, killing at least twenty-seven people and injuring dozens more including women and children.
Muslim terrorists force their way into a home and deliberately cripple a young girl by shooting her in both legs.
The Mujahideen abducts two civilians from their home and shoots one to death in captivity.
Mujahideen terrorists force their way into a civilian's house and shoot him to death.
A television station director is killed by Islamic terrorists outside his home.
A 'Christian Peacemaker' pacifist is kidnapped by Islamic radicals, held for three months, tortured and then shot to death.
The decapitated bodies of two men abducted two days earlier by religious extremists are found in the desert.
A police officer is killed by a Taliban landmine.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber attempts a political assassination.  Two people are killed in the blast.
Four Americans are killed by a remote-controlled blast while providing security to a group of Afghan civilians.
Suicide bombers kill a young girl on her way to school and a man on a motorbike.
A paint shop is the target of a terror blast as eight bodies are found bound and executed elsewhere in the city.
al-Qaeda suicide bombers tear apart forty-four poor Shias living in a slum in two separate market attacks.  About two-hundred others are injured.  Eight are hanged or beaten to death in revenge
Islamic militants kill a 44-year-old Buddhist as he is riding his motorcycle.  They also bomb a Buddhist temple, injuring a young girl and her mother.
Jihadis kill six civilians with a remote-controlled bomb and shoot two policemen to death in a separate attack.
A civilian is abducted, tortured and killed by Muslim radicals.
Islamists kill a man and pin a note to his body.
A boy is abducted and beheaded by the Mujahideen.
At least five people are killed when Islamic radicals set off a bomb along a city street.
Three civilians, including a child, are killed by two terrorist bombings.
An Islamic militant sets off a suicide blast to avoid arrest.  A mother and two children are blown apart as well.
After keeping him in captivity for two days under harsh conditions, the Hizb-ul-Mujahideen hang an abducted civilian.
Radicals gun down a journalist outside his home.
The Taliban execute four Albanian cleaning-company contractors that were abducted a day earlier.
Religious extremists attack a police post, killing five officers.
Eighty-seven victims of sectarian violence are found in at least four separate locations around the city in a 24-hour period.
In a suspected Muslim attack, a 33-year-old Catholic nun is stabbed to death by an intruder.
A man and his son are attacked by Muslim radicals while riding home on a motorbike.  Both are killed.
Islamists attack a husband and wife on a road, killing the man and leaving the woman severely injured.
Twenty-two bodies, victims of sectarian violence, are reported found.
Jihadis murder two Shia pilgrims walking by the road and kill two other innocents in separate bomb attacks.
Two people are killed when religious fundamentalists bomb a photography studio.
A woman and two children are among the causalities as a suicide bomber on a bicycle pedals his way to paradise.
An older husband and wife are shot to death by Hizb-ul-Mujahideen terrorists after forcing their way into the couple's home.
Radical Sunnis invade a home and kill a translator and his son inside.
Islamic terrorists kill three schoolgirls with a roadside bomb.
Sunni radicals attack a checkpoint at an intersection, killing three civilians.
Jihad gunmen murder four college students.  Another civilian is killed in a bombing.
An ice cream vendor is murdered and his 8-year-old son injured by militant Islamists.
In a shocking attack, a group of Muslims walk into a government office and gun down six officials meeting in a conference room.
The Taliban attack a construction site, killing a guard and taking two people hostage.
Sunni rebels (Jundollah, 'God's Soldiers') in Iran pose as police officers to stop cars carrying Shias, then machine-gun the occupants, killing twenty-one.
A Fedayeen suicide bomber blows up a minibus, and seven bodies are found over the last two days, some showing signs of torture.
The Taliban kill nine policemen with a bomb as they are transporting the bodies of four Albanians kidnapped and murdered earlier.
Sunni gunmen shoot Shia pilgrims from a passing car, killing three.
Sunni extremists kill two more Shia pilgrims with a roadside bomb.
Muslim gunmen murder a young civilian.
Religious extremists assassinate a former governor, two relatives and two employees in a residential neighborhood.
A woman and nine others are injured in a powerful Hizb-ul-Mujahideen car blast.
A 39-year-old man is murdered by Islamic separatists.
Islamists gun down a 53-year-old man who was riding out to his rubber plantation.
The bodies of twenty-two men showing signs of torture are found by police.
Twelve bodies are found in the capital and Jihadis also gun down two civilians in Ramadi.
Two policemen are killed by the Taliban.  The fundamentalists take four other people hostage in the attack.
Religious extremists abduct and behead two soldiers.
Jihadi gunmen murder four people.
al-Qaeda militants detonate a bomb on a road, killing seven people and injuring four.
Al Mansooran terrorists kill two security guards by tossing a grenade into their complex.
After ascertaining that the victims were Punjabis, Muslim radicals shoot three men at a picnic area, killing two.
Islamic militants are suspected in a bombing attack on a security convoy that leaves seven dead.
Militants invade a home and kill a man while injuring his wife.
Four separate attacks by Muslim radicals leave nine dead, including a woman and a university lecturer
Passengers on a minibus are the targets of Islamic terrorists who kill at least three with a bomb.
Muslims kill three people in a coffee shop by skillfully hiding a bomb in a bag.  Twenty-three people are injured, many seriously.
A civilian is murdered by the Mujahideen.
Religious extremists stage a vicious attack on a police vehicle in a remote area, killing all four occupants.
Islamic insurgents attack a police station with rockets and arms fire, killing seventeen people, including two civilians.
A humanitarian worker is killed by an Islamic militia as he is delivering food supplies.
Muslims gun down a father of seven in front of a Lutheran church.  The victim was a convert from Islam.
Islamists kill a pro-government cleric and abduct three other people.
